155/*
156 Notes:
157 -- collideLoc and collideNormal will only be filled in if result is true;
158 they are undefined if result is false.
159 -- either collideLoc or collideNormal may be null if you don't need 'em.
160 -- collideLoc is not guaranteed to lie precisely on either 'a' or 'b'!
161 (this matters iff the objects are overlapping and thus have multiple/ambiguous
162 collision points; we pick an 'in-between' spot to simplify matters, such that
163 the same spot will be used for the collision in both directions)
164 -- collideNormal is the normal the collision surface at 'a' at collideLoc.
165 (thus the normal for b is exactly opposite in direction)
166 -- collideNormal is guaranteed to be a unit vector
167*/
168typedef Bool (*CollideTestProc)(const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo);
169
170// if the dist is greater than maxDist, return false, and the output stuff is undefined.
171typedef Bool (*DistCalcProc)
172(
173 const Coord3D *posA,
174 const Object *objA,
175 const Coord3D *posB,
176 const Object *objB,
177 Real& abDistSqr,
178 Coord3D& abVec,
179 Real maxDistSqr
180);

189#ifdef FILTER_PROFILING
190Bool DoFilterProfiling = false;
191#endif
192
193//DECLARE_PERF_TIMER(filtersAllow)
194inline Bool filtersAllow(PartitionFilter **filters, Object *objOther)
195{
196 //USE_PERF_TIMER(filtersAllow)
197#ifdef FILTER_PROFILING
198 const Int MAXR = 32;
199 static const char* names[MAXR];
200 static Int rejections[MAXR];
201 static Int usefulRejections[MAXR];
202 static Int calls = 0;
203 static Int maxEver = 0;
204
205 Int idx;
206 Bool allow = true;
207
208 if (DoFilterProfiling)
209 {
210 if (calls == 0)
211 {
212 for (idx = 0; idx < MAXR; ++idx)
213 {
214 names[idx] = NULL;
215 rejections[idx] = 0;
216 usefulRejections[idx] = 0;
217 }
218 maxEver = 0;
219 }
220 ++calls;
221 }
222
223 for (PartitionFilter **fp = filters; fp && *fp; fp++)
224 {
225 if (!(*fp)->allow(objOther))
226 {
227 if (DoFilterProfiling)
228 {
229 const char** namesarr = names;
230 for (idx = 0; idx < maxEver; ++idx)
231 if (namesarr[idx] == (*fp)->debugGetName())
232 break;
233 if (idx == maxEver)
234 {
235 namesarr[maxEver++] = (*fp)->debugGetName();
236 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(maxEver<MAXR,("hmm, enlarge this array"));
237 }
238 ++rejections[idx];
239 if (allow)
240 ++usefulRejections[idx];
241 allow = false;
242 if (maxEver < idx)
243 maxEver = idx;
244 }
245 else
246 {
247 return false;
248 }
249 }
250 }
251
252 if (DoFilterProfiling && calls > 0 && calls % 1000==0)
253 {
254 DEBUG_LOG(("\n\n"));
255 for (idx = 0; idx < maxEver; idx++)
256 {
257 DEBUG_LOG(("rejections[%s] = %d (useful = %d)\n",names[idx],rejections[idx],usefulRejections[idx]));
258 }
259 }
260
261 return allow;
262#else
263 for (PartitionFilter **fp = filters; fp && *fp; fp++)
264 {
265 if (!(*fp)->allow(objOther))
266 {
267 return false;
268 }
269 }
270 // assume true if no filters rejected it
271 return true;
272#endif
273}

275//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
276inline void vecDiff_2D(const Coord3D *posA, const Coord3D *posB, Coord3D *resultVec)
277{
278 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(posA && posB && resultVec, ("null parm"));
279 resultVec->x = posA->x - posB->x;
280 resultVec->y = posA->y - posB->y;
281 resultVec->z = 0.0f;
282}
283
284//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
285inline void vecDiff_3D(const Coord3D *posA, const Coord3D *posB, Coord3D *resultVec)
286{
287 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(posA && posB && resultVec, ("null parm"));
288 resultVec->x = posA->x - posB->x;
289 resultVec->y = posA->y - posB->y;
290 resultVec->z = posA->z - posB->z;
291}
292
293//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
294inline Real calcSqrDist_2D(const Coord3D *dist)
295{
296 return sqr(dist->x) + sqr(dist->y);
297}
298
299//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
300inline Real calcSqrDist_3D(const Coord3D *dist)
301{
302 return sqr(dist->x) + sqr(dist->y) + sqr(dist->z);
303}
304
305//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
306inline Int absInt(Int a)
307{
308 if (a < 0) return -a; else return a;
309}
310
311//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
312inline Int minInt(Int a, Int b)
313{
314 if (a < b) return a; else return b;
315}
316
317//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
318inline Int maxInt(Int a, Int b)
319{
320 if (a > b) return a; else return b;
321}
322
323//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
324inline Real minReal(Real a, Real b)
325{
326 if (a < b) return a; else return b;
327}
328
329//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
330inline Real maxReal(Real a, Real b)
331{
332 if (a > b) return a; else return b;
333}

375//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
376inline void projectCoord3D(Coord3D *coord, const Coord3D *unitDir, Real dist)
377{
378 coord->x += unitDir->x * dist;
379 coord->y += unitDir->y * dist;
380 coord->z += unitDir->z * dist;
381}
382
383//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
384inline void flipCoord3D(Coord3D *coord)
385{
386 coord->x = -coord->x;
387 coord->y = -coord->y;
388 coord->z = -coord->z;
389}
390
391//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
392static void testRotatedPointsAgainstRect(
393 const Coord2D *pts, // an array of 4
394 const CollideInfo *a,
395 Coord2D *avg,
396 Int *avgTot
397)
398{
399 //DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(a->geom.getGeomType() == GEOMETRY_BOX, ("only boxes are ok here"));
400 Real major = a->geom.getMajorRadius();
401 Real minor = (a->geom.getGeomType() == GEOMETRY_SPHERE) ? a->geom.getMajorRadius() : a->geom.getMinorRadius();
402
403 Real c = (Real)Cos(-a->angle);
404 Real s = (Real)Sin(-a->angle);
405
406 for (Int i = 0; i < 4; ++i, ++pts)
407 {
408 // convert to a delta relative to rect ctr
409 Real ptx = pts->x - a->position.x;
410 Real pty = pts->y - a->position.y;
411
412 // inverse-rotate it to the right coord system
413 Real ptx_new = (Real)fabs(ptx*c - pty*s);
414 Real pty_new = (Real)fabs(ptx*s + pty*c);
415
416 #ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
417 Real mag_a = sqr(ptx)+sqr(pty);
418 Real mag_b = sqr(ptx_new)+sqr(pty_new);
419 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(fabs(mag_a - mag_b) <= 1.0, ("hmm, unlikely"));
420 #endif
421
422 if (ptx_new <= major && pty_new <= minor)
423 {
424 avg->x += pts->x;
425 avg->y += pts->y;
426 *avgTot += 1;
427 }
428 }
429}
430
431//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
432static void rectToFourPoints(
433 const CollideInfo *a, // z is ignored
434 Coord2D pts[]
435)
436{
437 Real c = (Real)Cos(a->angle);
438 Real s = (Real)Sin(a->angle);
439
440 Real exc = a->geom.getMajorRadius()*c;
441 Real eyc = a->geom.getMinorRadius()*c;
442 Real exs = a->geom.getMajorRadius()*s;
443 Real eys = a->geom.getMinorRadius()*s;
444
445 // tl
446 pts[0].x = a->position.x - exc - eys;
447 pts[0].y = a->position.y + eyc - exs;
448
449 // tr
450 pts[1].x = a->position.x + exc - eys;
451 pts[1].y = a->position.y + eyc + exs;
452
453 // bl
454 pts[2].x = a->position.x - exc + eys;
455 pts[2].y = a->position.y - eyc - exs;
456
457 // br
458 pts[3].x = a->position.x + exc + eys;
459 pts[3].y = a->position.y - eyc + exs;
460}

462//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
466static Bool xy_collideTest_Circle_Rect(const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
467{
468 Bool result = xy_collideTest_Rect_Circle(b, a, cinfo);
469 if (cinfo)
470 flipCoord3D(&cinfo->normal);
471 return result;
472}
473
474//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
478static Bool xy_collideTest_Rect_Circle(const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
479{
480#if 1
482 // but still not as accurate as is could be. (srj)
483 CollideInfo btmp = *b;
484 btmp.geom.setMinorRadius(btmp.geom.getMajorRadius());
485 return xy_collideTest_Rect_Rect(a, &btmp, cinfo);
486#else
487 // note, this actually tests the intersection of the the rect with the circle's
488 // bounding box. in practice, this is usually good enough, since most of
489 // our sphere/cyl shapes are small relative to boxes. (in fact, the WWMath
490 // library takes a similar shortcut when colliding spheres with boxes in 3d.
491 // so I figured it was probably good enough for us too.)
492
493 Real circ_l = b->position.x - b->geom.getMajorRadius();
494 Real circ_r = b->position.x + b->geom.getMajorRadius();
495 Real circ_t = b->position.y - b->geom.getMajorRadius();
496 Real circ_b = b->position.y + b->geom.getMajorRadius();
497 Real rect_l = a->position.x - a->geom.getMajorRadius();
498 Real rect_r = a->position.x + a->geom.getMajorRadius();
499 Real rect_t = a->position.y - a->geom.getMinorRadius();
500 Real rect_b = a->position.y + a->geom.getMinorRadius();
501
502 if (circ_r >= rect_l && circ_l <= rect_r &&
503 circ_b >= rect_t && circ_t <= rect_b)
504 {
505 if (cinfo)
506 {
507 vecDiff_2D(&b->position, &a->position, &cinfo->normal);
508 cinfo->normal.normalize();
509 cinfo->loc.x = (maxReal(circ_l, rect_l) + minReal(circ_r, rect_r)) * 0.5f;
510 cinfo->loc.y = (maxReal(circ_t, rect_t) + minReal(circ_b, rect_b)) * 0.5f;
511 cinfo->loc.z = (a->position.z + b->position.z) * 0.5f;
512 }
513 return true;
514 }
515 return false;
516#endif
517}
518
519//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
523static Bool xy_collideTest_Circle_Circle(const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
524{
525 Coord3D diff;
526 vecDiff_2D(&b->position, &a->position, &diff);
527 Real distSqr = calcSqrDist_2D(&diff);
528 Real touchingDistSqr = sqr(a->geom.getMajorRadius() + b->geom.getMajorRadius());
529 if (distSqr <= touchingDistSqr)
530 {
531 // calc the approximate location and normal.
532 if (cinfo)
533 {
534 cinfo->normal = diff;
535 cinfo->normal.normalize();
536 cinfo->loc = a->position;
537 projectCoord3D(&cinfo->loc, &cinfo->normal, a->geom.getMajorRadius());
538 }
539
540 return true;
541 }
542 return false;
543}
544
545//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
549static Bool xy_collideTest_Rect_Rect(const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
550{
551 Coord2D pts[4];
552 Coord2D avg; avg.x = avg.y = 0.0f;
553 Int avgTot = 0;
554
555 rectToFourPoints(a, pts);
556 testRotatedPointsAgainstRect(pts, b, &avg, &avgTot);
557
558 rectToFourPoints(b, pts);
559 testRotatedPointsAgainstRect(pts, a, &avg, &avgTot);
560
561 if (avgTot > 0)
562 {
563 if (cinfo)
564 {
565 // this is a little hokey, but generally adequate...
566 cinfo->loc.x = avg.x / avgTot;
567 cinfo->loc.y = avg.y / avgTot;
568 cinfo->loc.z = (a->position.z + b->position.z) * 0.5f;
569
570 // yow, what exactly does it mean to find the normal to two *intersecting*
571 // rects? with "true" physics we could project ahead and determine
572 // what the collision point would be, which would of course always
573 // give a perfect, symmetrical normal. however, we almost always determine
574 // collisions "after the fact" and thus the rects already intersect, meaning
575 // that it's tricky to find the normal. we could do it the "right" way, which
576 // would be to back up the objects to find the perfect point (see above), but
577 // we don't have velocity information at this point, so we can't really
578 // do that. so, naturally, we provide a (poor) guess by just doing the center-to-center
579 // normal. this is rarely the correct surface normal for a box-box collision,
580 // but until I either (a) rewrite everything to have predictive collisions,
581 // or (b) come up with a better definition of a useful normal in this case,
582 // I'm not sure we can do a whole lot better... (srj)
583 vecDiff_2D(&b->position, &a->position, &cinfo->normal);
584 cinfo->normal.normalize();
585 }
586 return true;
587 }
588 return false;
589}
590
591//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
592inline Bool z_collideTest_Sphere_Nonsphere(CollideTestProc xyproc, const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
593{
594 // case 1: center of sphere is within the nonsphere z-space.
595 if (a->position.z >= b->position.z && a->position.z <= b->position.z + b->geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition())
596 {
597 if (xyproc(a, b, cinfo))
598 {
599 // a side-to-side collision; just need to adjust the z-coord of collideLoc
600 if (cinfo)
601 {
602 cinfo->loc.z = a->position.z;
603 }
604 return true;
605 }
606 return false;
607 }
608
609 // case 2: center of sphere is above or below nonsphere, but within
610 // major-radius of top or bottom.
611
612 // 2a: sphere is below the nonsphere
613 Real b_bot = b->position.z;
614 if (a->position.z < b_bot && a->position.z + a->geom.getMajorRadius() >= b_bot)
615 {
616 // find the radius of the slice of the sphere that is at b_bot
617 CollideInfo amod = *a;
618 amod.position.z = b_bot;
619 amod.geom.setMajorRadius((Real)sqrtf(sqr(a->geom.getMajorRadius()) - sqr(b_bot - a->position.z)));
620 if (xyproc(&amod, b, cinfo))
621 {
622 // if you want to have 'end' collisions, you should add something like:
623 // if (circle a is contained by circle b) normal points straight up;
624 // but since that's currently never possible (and even if it was, wouldn't matter)
625 // we don't bother with the calculation.
626 return true;
627 }
628 return false;
629 }
630
631 // 2b: sphere is above the nonsphere
632 Real b_top = b->position.z + b->geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition();
633 if (a->position.z > b_top && a->position.z - a->geom.getMajorRadius() <= b_top)
634 {
635 CollideInfo amod = *a;
636 amod.position.z = b_top;
637 amod.geom.setMajorRadius((Real)sqrtf(sqr(a->geom.getMajorRadius()) - sqr(a->position.z - b_top)));
638 if (xyproc(&amod, b, cinfo))
639 {
640 // if you want to have 'end' collisions, you should add something like:
641 // if (circle a is contained by circle b) normal points straight down;
642 // but since that's currently never possible (and even if it was, wouldn't matter)
643 // we don't bother with the calculation.
644 return true;
645 }
646 return false;
647 }
648
649 return false;
650}
651
652//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
653inline Bool z_collideTest_Nonsphere_Nonsphere(CollideTestProc xyproc, const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
654{
655 // note: we already know that there is a z-intersection (our caller filters that out)
656 // so we need not recheck that here.
657
658 // Preflight for close objects.
659 Real dSqr = sqr(a->position.x-b->position.x) + sqr(a->position.y-b->position.y);
660 Real minRadius = a->geom.getMajorRadius();
661 Real r = a->geom.getMinorRadius();
662 if (minRadius>r) minRadius = r;
663 r = b->geom.getMajorRadius();
664 if (minRadius>r) minRadius = r;
665 r = b->geom.getMinorRadius();
666 if (minRadius>r) minRadius = r;
667
668 Bool closeEnough = sqr(minRadius) > dSqr;
669
670 if (closeEnough || xyproc(a, b, cinfo))
671 {
672 // since we allow objects to overlap at times, how do we distinguish
673 // between a "top-to-bottom" vs "side-to-side" collision?
674 // currently, we don't: cylindrical shapes currently never collide
675 // top-to-bottom, so we just declare everything to be side-to-side.
676 // if this changes, need to smarten this.
677
678 // case 1: side-to-side collision
679 // just need to adjust the z-coord of collideLoc
680 if (cinfo)
681 {
682 if (b->position.z > a->position.z)
683 cinfo->loc.z = (b->position.z + a->position.z + a->geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition()) * 0.5f;
684 else
685 cinfo->loc.z = (a->position.z + b->position.z + b->geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition()) * 0.5f;
686 }
687 return true;
688 }
689
690 return false;
691}
692
693//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
694static Bool collideTest_Sphere_Sphere(const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
695{
696 Coord3D diff;
697 vecDiff_3D(&b->position, &a->position, &diff);
698 Real distSqr = calcSqrDist_3D(&diff);
699 Real touchingDistSqr = sqr(a->geom.getMajorRadius() + b->geom.getMajorRadius());
700 if (distSqr <= touchingDistSqr)
701 {
702 if (cinfo)
703 {
704 cinfo->normal = diff;
705 cinfo->normal.normalize();
706 cinfo->loc = a->position;
707 projectCoord3D(&cinfo->loc, &cinfo->normal, a->geom.getMajorRadius());
708 }
709
710 return true;
711 }
712 return false;
713}
714
715//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
716static Bool collideTest_Sphere_Cylinder(const CollideInfo *a, const CollideInfo *b, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo)
717{
718 return z_collideTest_Sphere_Nonsphere(xy_collideTest_Circle_Circle, a, b, cinfo);
719}

725}

769//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
770static Bool distCalcProc_CenterAndCenter_2D(
771 const Coord3D *posA,
772 const Object *objA,
773 const Coord3D *posB,
774 const Object *objB,
775 Real& abDistSqr,
776 Coord3D& abVec,
777 Real maxDistSqr
778)
779{
780 // note that object positions are defined as the bottom center of the geometry,
781 // thus we must add the radius to the z coord to get the proper center of the bounding sphere.
782 Coord3D diff;
783 diff.x = posB->x - posA->x;
784 diff.y = posB->y - posA->y;
785 diff.z = 0.0f;
786
787 //if (abDistSqr)
788 {
789 abDistSqr = sqr(diff.x) + sqr(diff.y);
790 }
791
792 //if (abVec)
793 {
794 abVec = diff;
795 }
796
797 return abDistSqr < maxDistSqr;
798}
799
800//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
801static Bool distCalcProc_BoundaryAndBoundary_2D(
802 const Coord3D *posA,
803 const Object *objA,
804 const Coord3D *posB,
805 const Object *objB,
806 Real& abDistSqr,
807 Coord3D& abVec,
808 Real maxDistSqr
809)
810{
811 Coord3D diff;
812 diff.x = posB->x - posA->x;
813 diff.y = posB->y - posA->y;
814 diff.z = 0.0f;
815
816 Real actualDistSqr = sqr(diff.x) + sqr(diff.y);
817
818 Real shrinkFactor = 1.0f;
819 Real shrunkenDistSqr = actualDistSqr;
820 Real totalRad = (objA ? objA->getGeometryInfo().getBoundingCircleRadius() : 0.0f) +
821 (objB ? objB->getGeometryInfo().getBoundingCircleRadius() : 0.0f);
822
823 if (totalRad > 0.0f)
824 {
825 Real actualDist = sqrtf(actualDistSqr);
826 Real shrunkenDist = actualDist - totalRad;
827 if (shrunkenDist <= 0.0f)
828 {
829 shrinkFactor = 0.0f;
830 shrunkenDistSqr = 0.0f; // sorry, distances can't be negative
831 }
832 else
833 {
834 shrinkFactor = shrunkenDist / actualDist;
835 shrunkenDistSqr = sqr(shrunkenDist);
836 }
837 }
838
839 //if (abDistSqr)
840 {
841 abDistSqr = shrunkenDistSqr;
842 }
843
844 //if (abVec)
845 {
846 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(shrinkFactor >= 0.0f && shrinkFactor <= 1.0f, ("Hmm, this should not be possible."));
847 diff.x *= shrinkFactor;
848 diff.y *= shrinkFactor;
849 abVec = diff;
850 }
851 return abDistSqr < maxDistSqr;
852}
853
854//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
855static Bool distCalcProc_CenterAndCenter_3D(
856 const Coord3D *posA,
857 const Object *objA,
858 const Coord3D *posB,
859 const Object *objB,
860 Real& abDistSqr,
861 Coord3D& abVec,
862 Real maxDistSqr
863)
864{
865 // note that object positions are defined as the bottom center of the geometry,
866 // thus we must add the radius to the z coord to get the proper center of the bounding sphere.
867 Coord3D diff;
868 diff.x = posB->x - posA->x;
869 diff.y = posB->y - posA->y;
870 diff.z = posB->z - posA->z;
871
872 //if (abDistSqr)
873 {
874 abDistSqr = sqr(diff.x) + sqr(diff.y) + sqr(diff.z);
875 }
876
877 //if (abVec)
878 {
879 abVec = diff;
880 }
881 return abDistSqr < maxDistSqr;
882}
883
884//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
885static Bool distCalcProc_BoundaryAndBoundary_3D(
886 const Coord3D *posA,
887 const Object *objA,
888 const Coord3D *posB,
889 const Object *objB,
890 Real& abDistSqr,
891 Coord3D& abVec,
892 Real maxDistSqr
893)
894{
895 const GeometryInfo* geomA = objA ? &objA->getGeometryInfo() : NULL;
896 const GeometryInfo* geomB = objB ? &objB->getGeometryInfo() : NULL;
897
898 // note that object positions are defined as the bottom center of the geometry,
899 // thus we must add the radius to the z coord to get the proper center of the bounding sphere.
900 Coord3D diff;
901 diff.x = posB->x - posA->x;
902 diff.y = posB->y - posA->y;
903 diff.z = ((posB->z + (geomB ? geomB->getZDeltaToCenterPosition() : 0.0f))
904 - (posA->z + (geomA ? geomA->getZDeltaToCenterPosition() : 0.0f)));
905
906 Real actualDistSqr = sqr(diff.x) + sqr(diff.y) + sqr(diff.z);
907
908 Real shrinkFactor = 1.0f;
909 Real shrunkenDistSqr = actualDistSqr;
910 Real totalRad = (geomA?geomA->getBoundingSphereRadius():0) + (geomB?geomB->getBoundingSphereRadius():0);
911 if (totalRad > 0.0f)
912 {
913 Real actualDist = sqrtf(actualDistSqr);
914 Real shrunkenDist = actualDist - totalRad;
915 if (shrunkenDist <= 0.0f)
916 {
917 shrinkFactor = 0.0f;
918 shrunkenDistSqr = 0.0f; // sorry, distances can't be negative
919 }
920 else
921 {
922 shrinkFactor = shrunkenDist / actualDist;
923 shrunkenDistSqr = sqr(shrunkenDist);
924 }
925 }
926
927 //if (abDistSqr)
928 {
929 abDistSqr = shrunkenDistSqr;
930 }
931
932 //if (abVec)
933 {
934 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(shrinkFactor >= 0.0f && shrinkFactor <= 1.0f, ("Hmm, this should not be possible."));
935 diff.x *= shrinkFactor;
936 diff.y *= shrinkFactor;
937 diff.z *= shrinkFactor;
938 abVec = diff;
939 }
940 return abDistSqr < maxDistSqr;
941}

1060#ifdef FASTER_GCO
1061// nothing
1062#else
1063//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1064CellOutwardIterator::CellOutwardIterator(PartitionManager *mgr, Int x, Int y)
1065{
1066 m_mgr = mgr;
1067 m_cellCenterX = x;
1068 m_cellCenterY = y;
1069 m_cellRadius = 0;
1070 m_maxRadius = maxInt(maxInt(x, mgr->getCellCountX() - x), maxInt(y, mgr->getCellCountY() - y));
1071 m_delta[0] = m_delta[1] = 0;
1072 m_inc = -1;
1073 m_cnt = 0;
1074 m_axis = 1;
1075 m_iter = 1;
1076 m_delta[m_axis] -= m_inc;
1077}
1078
1079//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1080CellOutwardIterator::~CellOutwardIterator()
1081{
1082}
1083
1084//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1085PartitionCell *CellOutwardIterator::nextCell(Bool skipEmpties)
1086{
1087
1088try_again:
1089
1090 if (m_cellRadius <= m_maxRadius)
1091 {
1092
1093 if (m_iter > 0)
1094 {
1095 m_delta[m_axis] += m_inc;
1096 --m_iter;
1097 PartitionCell *cell = m_mgr->getCellAt(m_cellCenterX + m_delta[0], m_cellCenterY + m_delta[1]);
1098 if (!cell)
1099 goto try_again;
1100 if (skipEmpties && !cell->getFirstCoiInCell())
1101 goto try_again;
1102 return cell;
1103 }
1104
1105 m_axis += 1;
1106 if (m_axis >= 2)
1107 {
1108 m_axis = 0;
1109 m_inc = -m_inc;
1110 m_cnt += 1;
1111 m_cellRadius = maxInt(absInt(m_delta[0]), absInt(m_delta[1]));
1112 }
1113
1114 m_iter = m_cnt;
1115 goto try_again;
1116 }
1117
1118 return NULL;
1119}
1120#endif

1126//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1127CellAndObjectIntersection::CellAndObjectIntersection()
1128{
1129 m_cell = NULL;
1130 m_module = NULL;
1131 m_prevCoi = NULL;
1132 m_nextCoi = NULL;
1133}
1134
1135//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1136CellAndObjectIntersection::~CellAndObjectIntersection()
1137{
1138 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_prevCoi == NULL && m_nextCoi == NULL, ("destroying a linked COI"));
1139 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!getModule(), ("destroying an in-use COI"));
1140}
1141
1142//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1143void CellAndObjectIntersection::friend_addToCellList(CellAndObjectIntersection **pListHead)
1144{
1145 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_prevCoi == NULL && m_nextCoi == NULL && *pListHead != this, ("trying to add a cell to list, but it appears to already be in a list"));
1146
1147 this->m_nextCoi = *pListHead;
1148 if (*pListHead)
1149 (*pListHead)->m_prevCoi = this;
1150 *pListHead = this;
1151}
1152
1153//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1154void CellAndObjectIntersection::friend_removeFromCellList(CellAndObjectIntersection **pListHead)
1155{
1156#define DEBUG_ASSERTINLIST(c) \
1157 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH((c)->m_prevCoi != NULL || (c)->m_nextCoi != NULL || *pListHead == (c), ("cell is not in list"));
1158
1159 DEBUG_ASSERTINLIST(this);
1160
1161 if (this->m_prevCoi)
1162 {
1163 DEBUG_ASSERTINLIST(this->m_prevCoi);
1164 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(*pListHead != this, ("bad linkage"));
1165 this->m_prevCoi->m_nextCoi = this->m_nextCoi;
1166 }
1167 else
1168 {
1169 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(*pListHead == this, ("bad linkage"));
1170 *pListHead = this->m_nextCoi;
1171 }
1172
1173 if (this->m_nextCoi)
1174 {
1175 DEBUG_ASSERTINLIST(this->m_nextCoi);
1176 this->m_nextCoi->m_prevCoi = this->m_prevCoi;
1177 }
1178
1179 this->m_prevCoi = NULL;
1180 this->m_nextCoi = NULL;
1181
1182#undef DEBUG_ASSERTINLIST
1183}
1184
1185//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1186void CellAndObjectIntersection::addCoverage(PartitionCell *cell, PartitionData *module)
1187{
1188 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_cell == NULL || m_cell == cell, ("mismatch"));
1189 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_module == NULL || m_module == module, ("mismatch"));
1190
1191 if (m_module != NULL && m_module != module)
1192 {
1193 DEBUG_CRASH(("COI already in use by another module!"));
1194 return;
1195 }
1196
1197 if (m_cell == NULL)
1198 cell->friend_addToCellList(this);
1199
1200 m_cell = cell;
1201 m_module = module;
1202}
1203
1204//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1205void CellAndObjectIntersection::removeAllCoverage()
1206{
1207 if (m_module == NULL)
1208 {
1209 DEBUG_CRASH(("COI not in use"));
1210 return;
1211 }
1212
1213 m_cell->friend_removeFromCellList(this);
1214 m_cell = NULL;
1215 m_module = NULL;
1216}

1219//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1221
1222//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1223PartitionCell::PartitionCell()
1224{
1225 //Added By Sadullah Nader
1226 //Initializations inserted
1227 m_cellX = m_cellY = 0;
1228 //
1229 m_firstCoiInCell = NULL;
1230 m_coiCount = 0;
1231#ifdef PM_CACHE_TERRAIN_HEIGHT
1232 m_loTerrainZ = HUGE_DIST; // huge positive
1233 m_hiTerrainZ = -HUGE_DIST; // huge negative
1234#endif
1235 /*
1236 You may be asking yourself: why do we model the shroud for all players,
1237 rather than just the local player? And the answer is: because this allows
1238 us to checksum these values for net games, to help prevent "shroud cheaters"
1239 (who use a trainer to disable the shroud on their system).
1240 */
1241 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++i)
1242 {
1243 // Default is "passive shroud". 1,0.
1244 m_shroudLevel[i].m_currentShroud = 1;
1245 m_shroudLevel[i].m_activeShroudLevel = 0;
1246
1247 // default cash value is 0
1248 m_cashValue[i] = 0;
1249
1250 // default threat value is 0
1251 m_threatValue[i] = 0;
1252 }
1253}
1254
1255//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1256PartitionCell::~PartitionCell()
1257{
1258 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_firstCoiInCell == NULL && m_coiCount == 0, ("destroying a nonempty PartitionCell"));
1259 // but don't destroy the Cois; they don't belong to us
1260}
1261
1262//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1263void PartitionCell::invalidateShroudedStatusForAllCois(Int playerIndex)
1264{
1265 for (CellAndObjectIntersection* coi = m_firstCoiInCell; coi; coi = coi->getNextCoi())
1266 {
1267 coi->getModule()->invalidateShroudedStatusForPlayer(playerIndex);
1268 }
1269}
1270
1271//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1272void PartitionCell::addLooker(Int playerIndex)
1273{
1274 CellShroudStatus oldShroud = getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex );
1275 // The decreasing Algorithm: A 1 will go straight to -1, otherwise it just gets decremented
1276 m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud = min( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud - 1, -1 );
1277
1278 CellShroudStatus newShroud = getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex );
1279
1280// DEBUG_LOG(( "ADD %d, %d. CS = %d, AS = %d for player %d.\n",
1281// m_cellX,
1282// m_cellY,
1283// m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud,
1284// m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_activeShroudLevel,
1285// playerIndex
1286// ));
1287
1288 if( oldShroud != newShroud )
1289 {
1290 // On an edge trigger, tell all objects to think about their shroudedness
1291 invalidateShroudedStatusForAllCois( playerIndex );
1292
1293 if( playerIndex == ThePlayerList->getLocalPlayer()->getPlayerIndex() )
1294 {
1295 // and if this is the local player, do the Client update.
1296 TheDisplay->setShroudLevel(m_cellX, m_cellY, newShroud);
1297 TheRadar->setShroudLevel(m_cellX, m_cellY, newShroud);
1298 }
1299 }
1300}
1301
1302//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1303void PartitionCell::removeLooker(Int playerIndex)
1304{
1305 CellShroudStatus oldShroud = getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex );
1306 // the increasing Algorithm: a -1 goes up to min(1,activeLevel), otherwise it just gets incremented
1307 if( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud == -1 )
1308 m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud = min( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_activeShroudLevel, (Short)1 );
1309 else
1310 {
1311 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud < 0, ("Someone is RemoveLooker-ing on a cell that is not looked at. This will make a permanent shroud blob.") );
1312 m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud++;
1313 }
1314 CellShroudStatus newShroud = getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex );
1315
1316// DEBUG_LOG(( "REMOVE %d, %d. CS = %d, AS = %d for player %d.\n",
1317// m_cellX,
1318// m_cellY,
1319// m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud,
1320// m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_activeShroudLevel,
1321// playerIndex
1322// ));
1323
1324 if( oldShroud != newShroud )
1325 {
1326 // On an edge trigger, tell all objects to think about their shroudedness
1327 invalidateShroudedStatusForAllCois( playerIndex );
1328
1329 if( playerIndex == ThePlayerList->getLocalPlayer()->getPlayerIndex() )
1330 {
1331 // and if this is the local player, do the Client update.
1332 TheDisplay->setShroudLevel(m_cellX, m_cellY, newShroud);
1333 TheRadar->setShroudLevel(m_cellX, m_cellY, newShroud);
1334 }
1335 }
1336}
1337
1338//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1339void PartitionCell::addShrouder( Int playerIndex )
1340{
1341 CellShroudStatus oldShroud = getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex );
1342 // Increasing active shroud: activeLevel gets incremented, and CS is set to 1 if at zero
1343 // do the algorithm
1344 m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_activeShroudLevel++;
1345 if( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud == 0 )
1346 {
1347 m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud = 1;
1348 }
1349 CellShroudStatus newShroud = getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex );
1350
1351 if( oldShroud != newShroud )
1352 {
1353 // On an edge trigger, tell all objects to think about their shroudedness
1354 invalidateShroudedStatusForAllCois( playerIndex );
1355
1356 // and update the client if we are on the local player
1357 if( playerIndex == ThePlayerList->getLocalPlayer()->getPlayerIndex() )
1358 {
1359 TheDisplay->setShroudLevel(m_cellX, m_cellY, newShroud);
1360 TheRadar->setShroudLevel(m_cellX, m_cellY, newShroud);
1361 }
1362 }
1363}
1364
1365//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1366void PartitionCell::removeShrouder( Int playerIndex )
1367{
1368 // Decreasing active shroud: just decrement activeLevel. This will never result in a client change.
1369 // Either it was passive shroud and is now active, or it was being looked at and still is.
1370 m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_activeShroudLevel--;
1371 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_activeShroudLevel >= 0, ("Shroud generation has gone negative. This can't happen.") );
1372}
1373
1374//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1375//Bool PartitionCell::isShroudedForPlayer( Int playerIndex ) const
1376//{
1377 // There isn't an absolute answer. This cell is only shrouded in regards to a person
1378// return (m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud == 1);
1379//}
1380
1381//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1382CellShroudStatus PartitionCell::getShroudStatusForPlayer( Int playerIndex ) const
1383{
1384 // There are now three answers, but the question still requires "to whom"
1385
1386 if( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud == 1 )
1387 return CELLSHROUD_SHROUDED;
1388 else if( m_shroudLevel[playerIndex].m_currentShroud == 0 )
1389 return CELLSHROUD_FOGGED;// ie Nobody actively looking
1390 else
1391 return CELLSHROUD_CLEAR;
1392}

1486//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1487#ifdef _DEBUG
1488void PartitionCell::validateCoiList()
1489{
1490 CellAndObjectIntersection *nextCoi = 0, *prevCoi = 0;
1491 for (CellAndObjectIntersection *coi = getFirstCoiInCell(); coi; prevCoi = coi, coi = nextCoi)
1492 {
1493 nextCoi = coi->getNextCoi();
1494 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(coi->getPrevCoi() == prevCoi, ("coi link mismatch"));
1495 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(prevCoi == NULL || prevCoi->getNextCoi() == coi, ("coi link mismatch"));
1496 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH((coi == getFirstCoiInCell()) == (prevCoi == NULL) , ("coi link mismatch"));
1497 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(nextCoi == NULL || nextCoi->getPrevCoi() == coi, ("coi link mismatch"));
1498 }
1499}

1542//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1543PartitionData::PartitionData()
1544{
1545 //DEBUG_LOG(("create pd %08lx\n",this));
1546 m_next = NULL;
1547 m_prev = NULL;
1548 m_nextDirty = NULL;
1549 m_prevDirty = NULL;
1550 m_object = NULL;
1551 m_ghostObject = NULL;
1552 m_coiArrayCount = 0;
1553 m_coiArray = NULL;
1554 m_coiInUseCount = 0;
1555 m_doneFlag = 0;
1556 m_dirtyStatus = NOT_DIRTY;
1557 m_lastCell = NULL;
1558 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++i)
1559 {
1560 m_everSeenByPlayer[i] = false;
1561 m_shroudedness[i] = OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID;
1562 m_shroudednessPrevious[i] = OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID;
1563 }
1564}

1566//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1567PartitionData::~PartitionData()
1568{
1569 //DEBUG_LOG(("toss pd for pd %08lx obj %08lx\n",this,m_object));
1570 removeAllTouchedCells();
1571 freeCoiArray();
1572 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(ThePartitionManager, ("ThePartitionManager is null"));
1573 if (ThePartitionManager && ThePartitionManager->isInListDirtyModules(this))
1574 {
1575 //DEBUG_LOG(("remove pd %08lx from dirty list (%08lx %08lx)\n",this,m_prevDirty,m_nextDirty));
1576 ThePartitionManager->removeFromDirtyModules(this);
1577 //DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!ThePartitionManager->isInListDirtyModules(this), ("hmm\n"));
1578 }
1579}

1585 if (p)
1586 {

1590 }
1591
1592 DEBUG_CRASH(("this should never happen"));
1593 throw ERROR_BUG;
1594 return 0;
1595}

1597//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1598// only used to restore state after map border resizing and/or xfer!
1599void PartitionData::friend_setShroudednessPrevious(Int playerIndex, ObjectShroudStatus status)
1600{
1601 m_shroudednessPrevious[playerIndex] = status;
1602
1603 // if our status is anything but shrouded, assume we've never been seen by the player.
1604 m_everSeenByPlayer[playerIndex] = (status == OBJECTSHROUD_SHROUDED) ? false : true;
1605
1606 // if we're already invalid, mark us as special-invalid.
1607#ifndef DISABLE_INVALID_PREVENTION
1608 if (m_shroudedness[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID)
1609 m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID_BUT_PREVIOUS_VALID;
1610#endif
1611}
1612
1613//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1614ObjectShroudStatus PartitionData::getShroudedStatus(Int playerIndex)
1615{
1616 // sanity
1617 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( playerIndex >= 0 && playerIndex < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT,
1618 ("PartitionData::getShroudedStatus - Invalid player index '%d'\n", playerIndex) );
1619
1620 if (!ThePartitionManager->getUpdatedSinceLastReset())
1621 {
1622 // The shroud should be invalid until update has been called.
1623 // I'll set myself as invalid so the next time you ask I'll recompute. (If I just return Invalid, then the old state will persist unfairly over a reset)
1624 invalidateShroudedStatusForPlayer(playerIndex);
1625 return m_shroudedness[playerIndex];
1626 }
1627
1628#ifndef DISABLE_INVALID_PREVENTION
1629 if (m_shroudedness[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID || m_shroudedness[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID_BUT_PREVIOUS_VALID)
1630 {
1631 Bool updateShroudednessPrevious = (m_shroudedness[playerIndex] != OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID_BUT_PREVIOUS_VALID);
1632#else
1633 if (m_shroudedness[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID)
1634 {
1635#endif
1636 Int shroudedCells = 0;
1637 Int foggedCells = 0;
1638 CellAndObjectIntersection* coi = m_coiArray;
1639 for (Int i = m_coiInUseCount; i; --i, ++coi)
1640 {
1641 if( coi->getCell()->getShroudStatusForPlayer(playerIndex) == CELLSHROUD_SHROUDED )
1642 ++shroudedCells;
1643 else if( coi->getCell()->getShroudStatusForPlayer(playerIndex) == CELLSHROUD_FOGGED )
1644 ++foggedCells;
1645 }
1646
1647 if( m_coiInUseCount == 0 )
1648 { m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_SHROUDED; // Stuff off the map have no COIs since they aren't in the PartitionCell range
1649 m_everSeenByPlayer[playerIndex] = false; //force object as never seen by the player
1650 }
1651 else if( shroudedCells == m_coiInUseCount )
1652 { m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_SHROUDED; // every cell I use is shrouded
1653 m_everSeenByPlayer[playerIndex] = false; //force object as never seen by the player
1654 if (m_ghostObject && m_shroudednessPrevious[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_FOGGED)
1655 { //we are shrouding an area that used to be fogged so release our memory of what was there.
1656 m_ghostObject->freeSnapShot(playerIndex);
1657 }
1658 }
1659 else if( shroudedCells + foggedCells == m_coiInUseCount )
1660 {
1661 m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_FOGGED; //object is visible but fogged.
1662 if (m_object && m_ghostObject) //object does not exist for modules holding only GhostObjects
1663 {
1664 //fogged but may not be visible if faction unit or faction building that has not been seen before
1665 Player *player=ThePlayerList->getNthPlayer(playerIndex);
1666 if (player->getRelationship(m_object->getTeam()) == NEUTRAL)
1667 { //anything neutral that moves around will not be rendered inside fog.
1668 if (!m_object->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE))
1669 m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_SHROUDED;
1670 }
1671 else //Not neutral
1672 { //enemy unit will always be shrouded unless it's a building that's already been seen by the player. Fogged Mines are also always
1673 //shroued no matter what.
1674 if (!(m_object->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE) && m_everSeenByPlayer[playerIndex]) || m_object->isKindOf(KINDOF_MINE))
1675 m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_SHROUDED;
1676 }
1677 if (m_shroudedness[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_FOGGED)
1678 { //successfully applied fog to object so check if we need to freeze it's state
1679 if (m_shroudednessPrevious[playerIndex] < OBJECTSHROUD_FOGGED)
1680 { //object was not previously fogged but now is fogged.
1681 //need to record its current state so that it doesn't change
1682 //while fogged.
1683 m_ghostObject->snapShot(playerIndex);
1684 }
1685 }
1686 }
1687 }
1688 else if( shroudedCells == 0 && foggedCells == 0 )
1689 { //Record that this object was seen by the player. This info will be used to show fogged enemy faction buildings.
1690 m_everSeenByPlayer[playerIndex] = true;
1691 m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_CLEAR;
1692 if (m_ghostObject && m_shroudednessPrevious[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_FOGGED)
1693 { //object was previously fogged but now is visible so we no longer
1694 //need a ghost object.
1695 m_ghostObject->freeSnapShot(playerIndex);
1696 }
1697 } // no cell I use has anything
1698 else
1699 { //Record that this object was seen by the player. This info will be used to show fogged enemy faction buildings.
1700 m_everSeenByPlayer[playerIndex] = true;
1701 m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_PARTIAL_CLEAR; // I am at least partially clear otherwise
1702 if (m_ghostObject && m_shroudednessPrevious[playerIndex] == OBJECTSHROUD_FOGGED)
1703 { //object was previously fogged but now is visible so we no longer
1704 //need a ghost object.
1705 m_ghostObject->freeSnapShot(playerIndex);
1706 }
1707 }
1708#ifndef DISABLE_INVALID_PREVENTION
1709 if (m_coiInUseCount && updateShroudednessPrevious)
1710 {
1711#else
1712 if (m_coiInUseCount)
1713 {
1714#endif
1715 //only remember the previous state of objects actually on the map.
1716 m_shroudednessPrevious[playerIndex] = m_shroudedness[playerIndex];
1717 }
1718 }
1719
1720 return m_shroudedness[playerIndex];
1721}
1722
1723//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1724void PartitionData::removeAllTouchedCells()
1725{
1726 CellAndObjectIntersection *coi = m_coiArray;
1727 for (Int i = m_coiArrayCount; i > 0; --i, ++coi)
1728 {
1729 if (coi->getModule())
1730 {
1731 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(coi->getModule() == this, ("coi uses wrong module"));
1732 coi->removeAllCoverage();
1733 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!coi->getModule(), ("coi should no longer be in use"));
1734 --m_coiInUseCount;
1735 }
1736 }
1737 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiInUseCount == 0, ("hmm, coi count mismatch"));
1738}
1739
1740// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1741void PartitionData::addSubPixToCoverage(PartitionCell *cell)
1742{
1743 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiInUseCount < m_coiArrayCount, ("not enough cois allocated for this object"));
1744 if (cell)
1745 {
1746 // see if we already have a coi for this cell.
1747 CellAndObjectIntersection *coi = m_coiArray;
1748 CellAndObjectIntersection *coiToUse = NULL;
1749 for (Int i = __min(m_coiInUseCount,m_coiArrayCount); i; --i, ++coi)
1750 {
1751 if (coi->getCell() == cell)
1752 {
1753 coiToUse = coi;
1754 break;
1755 }
1756 }
1757 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(coiToUse != NULL || m_coiInUseCount < m_coiArrayCount, ("not enough cois allocated for this object"));
1758 if (coiToUse == NULL && m_coiInUseCount < m_coiArrayCount)
1759 {
1760 // nope, no coi for this cell, allocate a new one
1761 coiToUse = &m_coiArray[m_coiInUseCount++];
1762 }
1763 if (coiToUse)
1764 {
1765 coiToUse->addCoverage(cell, this);
1766 }
1767 }
1768}
1769
1770// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1771void PartitionData::doRectFill(
1772 Real centerX,
1773 Real centerY,
1774 Real halfsizeX,
1775 Real halfsizeY,
1776 Real angle
1777)
1778{
1779 Real c = (Real)Cos(angle);
1780 Real s = (Real)Sin(angle);
1781
1782 Real actualCellSize = ThePartitionManager->getCellSize();
1783 Real stepSize = actualCellSize * 0.5f; // in theory, should be getCellSize() exactly, but needs to be smaller to avoid aliasing problems
1784 Real ydx = s * stepSize;
1785 Real ydy = -c * stepSize;
1786 Real xdx = c * stepSize;
1787 Real xdy = s * stepSize;
1788
1789 // GS 12-26-02 Oh my. The step size has been fudged down to ensure that a cell is not jumped over,
1790 // but then the original step size was used to determine the number of steps. This error gets
1791 // more pronounced on bigger buildings. ie a 100 X 160 registers cells for a 80 x 100. If you
1792 // fudge one, you have to fudge the other.
1793// Real stepSizeInvTimes2 = 2.0f * ThePartitionManager->getCellSizeInv();
1794 Real stepSizeInvTimes2 = 2.0f * (1.0f / stepSize);
1795
1796 /*
1797 srj fixes subtle bug: need +1 to get all of misaligned geometries accted for.
1798 */
1799// Int numStepsX = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL(halfsizeX * stepSizeInvTimes2) + 1;
1800// Int numStepsY = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL(halfsizeY * stepSizeInvTimes2) + 1;
1801 Int numStepsX = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL(halfsizeX * stepSizeInvTimes2);
1802 Int numStepsY = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL(halfsizeY * stepSizeInvTimes2);
1803 // GS 12-26-02 Oh my part 2. Now that we are no longer greatly underestimating our COI imprint,
1804 // we don't need this fudge. The fudge is not in the calcMaxCOIForShape, so it just results in
1805 // good COIs getting dropped since we didn't allocate enough to handle this fudge.
1806
1807 Real tl_x = centerX - halfsizeX*c - halfsizeY*s;
1808 Real tl_y = centerY + halfsizeY*c - halfsizeX*s;
1809
1810 for (Int iy = 0; iy < numStepsY; ++iy, tl_x += ydx, tl_y += ydy)
1811 {
1812 Real x = tl_x;
1813 Real y = tl_y;
1814 for (Int ix = 0; ix < numStepsX; ++ix, x += xdx, y += xdy)
1815 {
1816 Int cellx, celly;
1817 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell(x, y, &cellx, &celly);
1818 PartitionCell *cell = ThePartitionManager->getCellAt(cellx, celly); // might be null if off the edge
1819 if (cell)
1820 {
1821 addSubPixToCoverage(cell);
1822 }
1823 }
1824 }
1825
1826}
1827
1828// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1829void PartitionData::hLineCircle(Int x1, Int x2, Int y)
1830{
1831 for (Int x = x1; x <= x2; ++x)
1832 {
1833 PartitionCell* cell = ThePartitionManager->getCellAt(x, y);
1834 if (cell)
1835 {
1836 addSubPixToCoverage(cell);
1837 }
1838 }
1839}
1840
1841// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1842void PartitionData::doCircleFill(
1843 Real centerX,
1844 Real centerY,
1845 Real radius
1846)
1847{
1848 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiInUseCount == 0, ("expected no coi in use here"));
1849
1850 Int cellCenterX, cellCenterY;
1851 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell(centerX, centerY, &cellCenterX, &cellCenterY);
1852
1853 Int cellRadius = ThePartitionManager->worldToCellDist(radius);
1854 if (cellRadius < 1)
1855 cellRadius = 1;
1856
1857 Int y = cellRadius - 1;
1858 Int dec = 3 - 2*cellRadius;
1859 for (Int x = 0; x < cellRadius; x++)
1860 {
1861 hLineCircle(cellCenterX - x, cellCenterX + x, cellCenterY + y);
1862 hLineCircle(cellCenterX - x, cellCenterX + x, cellCenterY - y);
1863 hLineCircle(cellCenterX - y, cellCenterX + y, cellCenterY + x);
1864 hLineCircle(cellCenterX - y, cellCenterX + y, cellCenterY - x);
1865
1866 if (dec >= 0)
1867 {
1868 dec += (1 - y) << 2;
1869 --y;
1870 }
1871 dec += (x << 2) + 6;
1872 }
1873}
1874
1875// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1876void PartitionData::doSmallFill(
1877 Real centerX,
1878 Real centerY,
1879 Real radius
1880)
1881{
1882 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiInUseCount == 0, ("expected no coi in use here"));
1883
1884 Real halfCellSize = ThePartitionManager->getCellSize() * 0.5f;
1885 if (radius > halfCellSize)
1886 {
1887 DEBUG_CRASH(("object is too large to use a 'small' geometry, truncating size to cellsize\n"));
1888 radius = halfCellSize;
1889 }
1890
1891 Int cx1, cy1, cx2, cy2;
1892 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell(centerX - radius, centerY - radius, &cx1, &cy1);
1893 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell(centerX + radius, centerY + radius, &cx2, &cy2);
1894
1895 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(absInt(cx2-cx1)<=1,("bad cx"));
1896 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(absInt(cy2-cy1)<=1,("bad cy"));
1897
1898 for (Int x = cx1; x <= cx2; x++)
1899 {
1900 for (Int y = cy1; y <= cy2; y++)
1901 {
1902 PartitionCell *cell = ThePartitionManager->getCellAt(x, y);
1903 if (cell)
1904 {
1905 m_coiArray[m_coiInUseCount++].addCoverage(cell, this);
1906 }
1907 }
1908 }
1909
1910 #ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
1911 for (int i = 0; i < m_coiInUseCount; i++)
1912 {
1913 for (int j = 0; j < i; j++)
1914 {
1915 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiArray[i].getCell() != m_coiArray[j].getCell(), ("dup cells"));
1916 }
1917 }
1918 #endif
1919}
1920
1921//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1922void PartitionData::addPossibleCollisions(PartitionContactList *ctList)
1923{
1924// actually, we do occasionally want to detect collisions of dead AIs.
1925// e.g., dead technicals flying thru the air should check for collisions with
1926// immobile structures, because otherwise they pass thru them, which looks dopey.
1927// if preventing dead-ai-collisions is necessary to fix something else, please
1928// ensure that the above case is cool before signing off. (srj)
1929#ifdef NOPE_READ_THE_COMMENT
1930 // dead objects never collide with things...
1931 AIUpdateInterface *ai = getObject()->getAIUpdateInterface();
1932 if (ai && ai->isAiInDeadState())
1933 {
1934 return;
1935 }
1936#endif
1937
1938 //DEBUG_LOG(("adding possible collision for %s\n",getObject()->getTemplate()->getName().str()));
1939
1940 CellAndObjectIntersection *myCoi = m_coiArray;
1941 for (Int i = m_coiInUseCount; i > 0; --i, ++myCoi)
1942 {
1943 PartitionCell *cell = myCoi->getCell();
1944 if (cell->getCoiCount() < 2)
1945 continue;
1946
1947 for (CellAndObjectIntersection *coi = cell->getFirstCoiInCell(); coi; coi = coi->getNextCoi())
1948 {
1949 PartitionData *that = coi->getModule();
1950 if (this != that)
1951 {
1952 ctList->addToContactList(this, that);
1953 }
1954 }
1955 }
1956}
1957
1958//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1959Bool PartitionData::collidesWith(const PartitionData *that, CollideLocAndNormal *cinfo) const
1960{
1961 const Object *thisObj = this->getObject();
1962 const Object *thatObj = that->getObject();
1963
1964 if( thisObj->isKindOf( KINDOF_NO_COLLIDE ) || thatObj->isKindOf( KINDOF_NO_COLLIDE ) )
1965 return FALSE; // A collision extent of zero size is still a point and can collide, but we don't always want to.
1966
1967 CollideInfo thisInfo(thisObj->getPosition(), thisObj->getGeometryInfo(), thisObj->getOrientation());
1968 CollideInfo thatInfo(thatObj->getPosition(), thatObj->getGeometryInfo(), thatObj->getOrientation());
1969
1970 // invariant for all geometries: first do z collision check.
1971 Real thisTop = thisInfo.position.z + thisInfo.geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition();
1972 Real thisBot = thisInfo.position.z - thisInfo.geom.getMaxHeightBelowPosition();
1973 Real thatTop = thatInfo.position.z + thatInfo.geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition();
1974 Real thatBot = thatInfo.position.z - thatInfo.geom.getMaxHeightBelowPosition();
1975 if (thisTop >= thatBot && thisBot <= thatTop)
1976 {
1977 GeometryType thisGeom = thisObj->getGeometryInfo().getGeomType();
1978 GeometryType thatGeom = thatObj->getGeometryInfo().getGeomType();
1979
1980 //
1981 // NOTE: This assumes geometry enumerations that start at GEOMETRY_FIRST AND depends on the
1982 // order in which they appear in the enum list
1983 //
1984 CollideTestProc collideProc = theCollideTestProcs[ (thisGeom - GEOMETRY_FIRST) * GEOMETRY_NUM_TYPES + (thatGeom - GEOMETRY_FIRST) ];
1985 return (*collideProc)(&thisInfo, &thatInfo, cinfo);
1986 }
1987 else
1988 {
1989 // no z-intersection -> no collision.
1990 return false;
1991 }
1992}
1993
1994//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1995/* See if thisObj collides with geom at pos & angle. */
1996Bool PartitionManager::geomCollidesWithGeom(const Coord3D* pos1,
1997 const GeometryInfo& geom1,
1998 Real angle1,
1999 const Coord3D* pos2,
2000 const GeometryInfo& geom2,
2001 Real angle2) const
2002{
2003 CollideInfo thisInfo(pos1, geom1, angle1);
2004 CollideInfo thatInfo(pos2, geom2, angle2);
2005
2006 // invariant for all geometries: first do z collision check.
2007 if (thisInfo.position.z + thisInfo.geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition() >= thatInfo.position.z &&
2008 thisInfo.position.z <= thatInfo.position.z + thatInfo.geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition())
2009 {
2010 GeometryType thisGeom = geom1.getGeomType();
2011 GeometryType thatGeom = geom2.getGeomType();
2012
2013 //
2014 // NOTE: This assumes geometry enumerations that start at GEOMETRY_FIRST AND depends on the
2015 // order in which they appear in the enum list
2016 //
2017 CollideTestProc collideProc = theCollideTestProcs[ (thisGeom - GEOMETRY_FIRST) * GEOMETRY_NUM_TYPES + (thatGeom - GEOMETRY_FIRST) ];
2018 CollideLocAndNormal cloc;
2019 return (*collideProc)(&thisInfo, &thatInfo, &cloc);
2020 }
2021 else
2022 {
2023 // no z-intersection -> no collision.
2024 return false;
2025 }
2026}
2027
2028//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2029void PartitionData::updateCellsTouched()
2030{
2031 GeometryType geom;
2032 Bool isSmall;
2033 Coord3D pos;
2034 Real angle,majorRadius,minorRadius;
2035
2036
2037 Object *obj = getObject();
2038 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(obj != NULL || m_ghostObject != NULL, ("must be attached to an Object here 1"));
2039
2040 if (obj)
2041 {
2042 //we have no object using this PartitionData but we still have a GhostObject so copy its data.
2043 geom = obj->getGeometryInfo().getGeomType();
2044 isSmall = obj->getGeometryInfo().getIsSmall();
2045 pos = *(obj->getPosition());
2046 angle = obj->getOrientation();
2047 majorRadius = obj->getGeometryInfo().getMajorRadius();
2048 minorRadius = obj->getGeometryInfo().getMinorRadius();
2049 }
2050 else if (m_ghostObject)
2051 {
2052 geom = m_ghostObject->getGeometryType();
2053 isSmall = m_ghostObject->getGeometrySmall();
2054 pos = *m_ghostObject->getParentPosition();
2055 angle = m_ghostObject->getParentAngle();
2056 majorRadius = m_ghostObject->getGeometryMajorRadius();
2057 minorRadius = m_ghostObject->getGeometryMinorRadius();
2058 }
2059
2060 removeAllTouchedCells();
2061 if (isSmall)
2062 {
2063 doSmallFill(pos.x, pos.y, majorRadius);
2064 }
2065 else
2066 {
2067 switch(geom)
2068 {
2069 case GEOMETRY_SPHERE:
2070 case GEOMETRY_CYLINDER:
2071 {
2072 doCircleFill(pos.x, pos.y, majorRadius);
2073 break;
2074 }
2075
2076 case GEOMETRY_BOX:
2077 {
2078 doRectFill(pos.x, pos.y, majorRadius, minorRadius, angle);
2079 break;
2080 }
2081 };
2082 }
2083
2084 Int currentCellIndexX, currentCellIndexY;
2085 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell( pos.x, pos.y, &currentCellIndexX, &currentCellIndexY );
2086 const PartitionCell *currentCell = ThePartitionManager->getCellAt( currentCellIndexX, currentCellIndexY );
2087 if(obj && currentCell != m_lastCell )
2088 {
2089 // To not expose PartitionCells, he will think in terms of points. He will
2090 // unlook at a point and look at the new point. We do the rounding and the
2091 // changing into PartitionCells
2092 obj->onPartitionCellChange();
2093 m_lastCell = currentCell;
2094 }
2095
2096 // if we have moved, our shroudedness status might be different for all players,
2097 // so it must all be invalidated.
2098 invalidateShroudedStatusForAllPlayers();
2099
2100#ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
2101 for (Int i = 0; i < m_coiInUseCount; i++)
2102 {
2103 for (Int j = 0; j < i; j++)
2104 {
2105 if (m_coiArray[i].getCell() == m_coiArray[j].getCell())
2106 {
2107 DEBUG_CRASH(("dup cells in COI array, this is bad"));
2108 }
2109 }
2110 }
2111#endif
2112
2113}

2118#ifndef DISABLE_INVALID_PREVENTION
2119 if (m_shroudedness[playerIndex] != OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID && m_shroudedness[playerIndex] != OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID_BUT_PREVIOUS_VALID)
2120#endif
2121 m_shroudedness[playerIndex] = OBJECTSHROUD_INVALID;
2122}

2129 invalidateShroudedStatusForPlayer(i);
2130 }

2137//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2138Int PartitionData::calcMaxCoiForShape(GeometryType geom, Real majorRadius, Real minorRadius, Bool isSmall)
2139{
2140 Int result;
2141
2142
2143 // THis is commented out, since some cases od big extets labeled small seem to be escaping.
2144 //M Lorenzen 8/26/03
2145// if (isSmall)
2146// {
2147// #if defined(_DEBUG) || defined(_INTERNAL)
2148// Int chk = calcMaxCoiForShape(geom, majorRadius, minorRadius, false);
2149// DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(chk <= 4, ("Small objects should be <= 4 cells, but I calced %s as %d\n",theObjName.str(),chk));
2150// #endif
2151// result = 4;
2152// }
2153// else
2154 {
2155 switch(geom)
2156 {
2157 case GEOMETRY_SPHERE:
2158 case GEOMETRY_CYLINDER:
2159 {
2160 // note that majorRadius is a radius, not a diameter.
2161 // this actually allocates a few too many, but that's ok.
2162 Int cells = ThePartitionManager->worldToCellDist(majorRadius*2) + 1;
2163 result = cells * cells;
2164 }
2165 case GEOMETRY_BOX:
2166 {
2167 Real diagonal = (Real)(sqrtf(majorRadius*majorRadius + minorRadius*minorRadius));
2168 Int cells = ThePartitionManager->worldToCellDist(diagonal*2) + 1;
2169 result = cells * cells;
2170 }
2171 };
2172 }
2173 if (result < 4)
2174 result = 4;
2175 return result;
2176}

2183
2184 GeometryType geom = obj->getGeometryInfo().getGeomType();
2185 Real majorRadius = obj->getGeometryInfo().getMajorRadius();
2186 Real minorRadius = obj->getGeometryInfo().getMinorRadius();
2187 Bool isSmall = obj->getGeometryInfo().getIsSmall();
2188#if defined(_DEBUG) || defined(_INTERNAL)
2189theObjName = obj->getTemplate()->getName();
2190#endif

2194//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2195void PartitionData::makeDirty(Bool needToUpdateCells)
2196{
2197 //DEBUG_LOG(("makeDirty for pd %08lx obj %08lx\n",this,m_object));
2198 if (!ThePartitionManager->isInListDirtyModules(this))
2199 {
2200 if (needToUpdateCells)
2201 m_dirtyStatus = NEED_CELL_UPDATE_AND_COLLISION_CHECK;
2202 else if (m_dirtyStatus == NOT_DIRTY)
2203 m_dirtyStatus = NEED_COLLISION_CHECK;
2204 ThePartitionManager->prependToDirtyModules(this);
2205 }
2206 else if (needToUpdateCells)
2207 {
2208 // If I am in the list already, I may be in there for a half update, so if my
2209 // needs have increased I'll upgrade what I want.
2210 m_dirtyStatus = NEED_CELL_UPDATE_AND_COLLISION_CHECK;
2211 }

2214//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2215void PartitionData::allocCoiArray()
2216{
2217 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiArrayCount == 0 && m_coiArray == NULL, ("hmm, coi should probably be null here"));
2218 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiInUseCount == 0, ("hmm, coi count mismatch"));
2219 m_coiArrayCount = calcMaxCoiForObject();
2220 m_coiArray = MSGNEW("PartitionManager_COI") CellAndObjectIntersection[m_coiArrayCount]; // may throw!
2221 m_coiInUseCount = 0;
2222 makeDirty(true);
2223}

2230 m_coiArrayCount = 0;
2231 m_coiInUseCount = 0;
2232 makeDirty(true);
2233}

2235//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2236void PartitionData::attachToObject(Object* object)
2237{
2238
2239 // remember who contains us
2240 m_object = object;
2241
2242 // we only snapshot things that are immobile and have something to draw. Don't need ghostobjects for others.
2243 if (object->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE))
2244 { const ThingTemplate *tmplate=object->getTemplate();
2245 const ModuleInfo &drawMod=tmplate->getDrawModuleInfo();
2246 //Objects with default draw modules usually don't need ghostobjects so skip them to save memory.
2247 Bool makeGhostObject=TRUE;
2248 for (Int i=0; i<drawMod.getCount(); i++)
2249 {
2250 if (strcmp(drawMod.getNthName(i).str(),"W3DDefaultDraw") == 0)
2251 { makeGhostObject=FALSE;
2252 break;
2253 }
2254 }
2255 if (makeGhostObject)
2256 m_ghostObject = TheGhostObjectManager->addGhostObject(object, this);
2257 }
2258
2259 //DEBUG_LOG(("attach pd for pd %08lx obj %08lx\n",this,m_object));
2260
2261 // (re)calc maxCoi and (re)alloc cois
2262 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiArrayCount == 0 && m_coiArray == NULL, ("hmm, coi should probably be null here"));
2263 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiInUseCount == 0, ("hmm, coi count mismatch"));
2264 freeCoiArray();
2265 allocCoiArray(); // may throw!
2266
2267 if (object)
2268 object->friend_setPartitionData(this);
2269 makeDirty(true);
2270}
2271
2272//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2273void PartitionData::detachFromObject()
2274{
2275 // this is a little hokey... if we are in the midst of processing the contact
2276 // list, we have to ensure that any potential collisions get removed from that
2277 // list, since we are about to go bye-bye. ugly, but effective. (srj)
2278 //
2279 // note 2: we used to do this in our dtor, but it's too late then, since we require
2280 // our Object to still be present in order to figure out what to remove.
2281 // so do it here, since detaching it should nuke it from the obj list anyway. (srj)
2282 if (TheContactList)
2283 TheContactList->removeSpecificPartitionData(this);
2284
2285 if (m_object)
2286 m_object->friend_setPartitionData(NULL);
2287 removeAllTouchedCells();
2288 freeCoiArray();
2289
2290 //DEBUG_LOG(("detach pd for pd %08lx obj %08lx\n",this,m_object));
2291
2292 // no longer attached to object
2293 m_object = NULL;
2294 TheGhostObjectManager->removeGhostObject(m_ghostObject);
2295 m_ghostObject = NULL;
2296}
2297
2298//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2299void PartitionData::attachToGhostObject(GhostObject* object)
2300{
2301
2302 // remember who contains us
2303 m_object = NULL; //it's only attached to a ghost object, no parent object.
2304 m_ghostObject = object;
2305
2306 // (re)calc maxCoi and (re)alloc cois
2307 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiArrayCount == 0 && m_coiArray == NULL, ("hmm, coi should probably be null here"));
2308 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_coiInUseCount == 0, ("hmm, coi count mismatch"));
2309 freeCoiArray();
2310
2311 m_coiArrayCount = calcMaxCoiForShape(object->getGeometryType(), object->getGeometryMajorRadius(), object->getGeometryMinorRadius(),object->getGeometrySmall());
2312 m_coiArray = MSGNEW("PartitionManager_COI") CellAndObjectIntersection[m_coiArrayCount]; // may throw!
2313 m_coiInUseCount = 0;
2314 makeDirty(true);
2315
2316 if (m_ghostObject)
2317 m_ghostObject->updateParentObject(NULL,this);
2318}

2320//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2321void PartitionData::detachFromGhostObject(void)
2322{
2323 // this is a little hokey... if we are in the midst of processing the contact
2324 // list, we have to ensure that any potential collisions get removed from that
2325 // list, since we are about to go bye-bye. ugly, but effective. (srj)
2326 //
2327 // note 2: we used to do this in our dtor, but it's too late then, since we require
2328 // our Object to still be present in order to figure out what to remove.
2329 // so do it here, since detaching it should nuke it from the obj list anyway. (srj)
2330 if (TheContactList)
2331 TheContactList->removeSpecificPartitionData(this);
2332
2333 removeAllTouchedCells();
2334 freeCoiArray();
2335
2336 //DEBUG_LOG(("detach pd for pd %08lx obj %08lx\n",this,m_object));
2337
2338 // no longer attached to object
2339 m_object = NULL;
2340 m_ghostObject = NULL;
2341}

2343//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2344inline UnsignedInt hash2ints(Int a, Int b)
2345{
2346 // do it this way so that [a,b] always hashes to the same value as [b,a].
2347 // this is unsophisticated but reasonable, since all ObjectIDs will
2348 // quite likely be well below 65536...
2349 if (a < b)
2350 {
2351 return (a<<16)+b;
2352 }
2353 else
2354 {
2355 return (b<<16)+a;
2356 }
2357}

2362//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2363
2364//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2365void PartitionContactList::addToContactList( PartitionData *obj, PartitionData *other )
2366{
2367 if (obj == other || obj == NULL || other == NULL)
2368 return;
2369
2370 Object* obj_obj = obj->getObject();
2371 Object* other_obj = other->getObject();
2372 if (obj_obj == NULL || other_obj == NULL)
2373 return;
2374
2375 // compute hash index based on object's ids.
2376 UnsignedInt hashValue = hash2ints(obj_obj->getID(), other_obj->getID());
2377 hashValue %= PartitionContactList_SOCKET_COUNT;
2378
2379 // make sure given hit has not already been recorded
2380 for (PartitionContactListNode* cd = m_contactHash[ hashValue ]; cd; cd = cd->m_nextHash )
2381 {
2382 if ((cd->m_obj == obj && cd->m_other == other) ||
2383 (cd->m_obj == other && cd->m_other == obj))
2384 {
2385 // already noted
2386 return;
2387 }
2388 }
2389
2390 // new hit
2391 PartitionContactListNode *ncd = newInstance(PartitionContactListNode);
2392 ncd->m_obj = obj;
2393 ncd->m_other = other;
2394 ncd->m_hashValue = hashValue;
2395
2396 // add to hash table
2397 ncd->m_nextHash = m_contactHash[ hashValue ];
2398 m_contactHash[ hashValue ] = ncd;
2399
2400 // add to list of contacts for this frame
2401 ncd->m_next = m_contactList;
2402 m_contactList = ncd;
2403
2404
2405#if 0
2406
2407Int depth = 0;
2408for (PartitionContactListNode *cd2 = m_contactHash[ hashValue ]; cd2; cd2 = cd2->m_nextHash )
2409{
2410 depth++;
2411}
2412if (depth > 3)
2413{
2414 DEBUG_LOG(("depth is %d for %s %08lx (%d) - %s %08lx (%d)\n",
2415 depth,obj_obj->getTemplate()->getName().str(),obj_obj,obj_obj->getID(),
2416 other_obj->getTemplate()->getName().str(),other_obj,other_obj->getID()
2417 ));
2418
2419 for (cd2 = m_contactHash[ hashValue ]; cd2; cd2 = cd2->m_nextHash )
2420 {
2421 UnsignedInt rawhash = djb2hash2ints(cd2->m_obj->getObject()->getID(), cd2->m_other->getObject()->getID());
2422 //hashValue %= PartitionContactList_SOCKET_COUNT;
2423
2424
2425 DEBUG_LOG(("ENTRY: %s %08lx (%d) - %s %08lx (%d) [rawhash %d]\n",
2426 cd2->m_obj->getObject()->getTemplate()->getName().str(),cd2->m_obj->getObject(),cd2->m_obj->getObject()->getID(),
2427 cd2->m_other->getObject()->getTemplate()->getName().str(),cd2->m_other->getObject(),cd2->m_other->getObject()->getID(),
2428 rawhash));
2429 }
2430}
2431
2432static Real aggtotal = 0;
2433static Real aggfull = 0;
2434static Real aggcount = 0;
2435for (int ii = 0; ii < PartitionContactList_SOCKET_COUNT; ++ii)
2436{
2437 if (m_contactHash[ii])
2438 aggfull += 1.0f;
2439
2440 for (cd2 = m_contactHash[ ii ]; cd2; cd2 = cd2->m_nextHash )
2441 {
2442 aggtotal += 1.0f;
2443 }
2444}
2445aggcount += 1.0f;
2446DEBUG_ASSERTLOG(((Int)aggcount)%1000!=0,("avg hash depth at %f is %f, fullness %f%%\n",
2447aggcount,aggtotal/(aggcount*PartitionContactList_SOCKET_COUNT),(aggfull*100)/(aggcount*PartitionContactList_SOCKET_COUNT)));
2448#endif
2449
2450
2451}
2452
2453//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2454void PartitionContactList::removeSpecificPartitionData(PartitionData* data)
2455{
2456 for (PartitionContactListNode* cd = m_contactList; cd; cd = cd->m_next)
2457 {
2458 if (cd->m_obj == data || cd->m_other == data)
2459 {
2460 cd->m_obj = NULL;
2461 cd->m_other = NULL;
2462 }
2463 }
2464}
2465
2466//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2467void PartitionContactList::resetContactList()
2468{
2469 // remove items from hash table
2470 PartitionContactListNode* cdnext;
2471 for (PartitionContactListNode* cd = m_contactList; cd; cd = cdnext)
2472 {
2473 cdnext = cd->m_next;
2474 cd->deleteInstance();
2475 }
2476
2477 memset(m_contactHash, 0, sizeof(m_contactHash));
2478 m_contactList = NULL;
2479}
2480
2481//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2482void PartitionContactList::processContactList()
2483{
2484 for (PartitionContactListNode* cd = m_contactList; cd; cd = cd->m_next)
2485 {
2486 if (cd->m_obj == NULL || cd->m_other == NULL)
2487 continue;
2488
2489 // we know that their partitions overlap; determine if they REALLY collide
2490 // before proceeding...
2491 CollideLocAndNormal cinfo;
2492 if (!cd->m_obj->friend_collidesWith(cd->m_other, &cinfo))
2493 continue;
2494
2495 Object* obj = cd->m_obj->getObject();
2496 Object* other = cd->m_other->getObject();
2497
2498 if( obj->getStatusBits().test( OBJECT_STATUS_NO_COLLISIONS ) ||
2499 other->getStatusBits().test( OBJECT_STATUS_NO_COLLISIONS ) )
2500 continue;
2501
2502 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(!(obj->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE) && other->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE)),
2503 ("we should never have collisions between two immobile things reported"));
2504
2505 // the onCollide() calls can remove the object(s) from the partition mgr,
2506 // thus destroying the partitiondata for 'em. go ahead and null these out here
2507 // so we won't be tempted to use 'em (since they might be bogus).
2508 cd->m_obj = NULL;
2509 cd->m_other = NULL;
2510
2511 obj->onCollide(other, &cinfo.loc, &cinfo.normal);
2512 flipCoord3D(&cinfo.normal);
2513
2514 //Before checking the "other" case, make sure that the previous collision didn't
2515 //absorb him. This becomes a conflict for pilots giving veterancy to transports
2516 //and pilots entering transports. Both would occur if these isDestroyed checks
2517 //were missing.
2518 if( !obj->isDestroyed() && !other->isDestroyed() )
2519 {
2520 other->onCollide(obj, &cinfo.loc, &cinfo.normal);
2521 }
2522
2523 //
2524 // NOTE: it is VERY IMPORTANT (for performance reasons) to not re-dirty immobile things.
2525 //
2526 // NOTE also that we re-get partitiondata from the object, since it might have been
2527 // removed from the partition system by the onCollide call...
2528 //
2529 if (!obj->isDestroyed() && obj->friend_getPartitionData() != NULL && !obj->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE))
2530 {
2531//DEBUG_LOG(("%d: re-dirtying collision of %s %08lx with %s %08lx\n",TheGameLogic->getFrame(),obj->getTemplate()->getName().str(),obj,other->getTemplate()->getName().str(),other));
2532 obj->friend_getPartitionData()->makeDirty(false);
2533 }
2534 if (!other->isDestroyed() && other->friend_getPartitionData() != NULL && !other->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE))
2535 {
2536//DEBUG_LOG(("%d: re-dirtying collision of %s %08lx with %s %08lx [other]\n",TheGameLogic->getFrame(),other->getTemplate()->getName().str(),other,obj->getTemplate()->getName().str(),obj));
2537 other->friend_getPartitionData()->makeDirty(false);
2538 }
2539 }
2540}

2572//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2573#ifdef PM_CACHE_TERRAIN_HEIGHT
2574static void calcHeights(const Region3D& world, Real cellSize, Int x, Int y, Real& loZ, Real& hiZ)
2575{
2576 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(TheTerrainLogic, ("no TheTerrainLogic"));
2577 Real xbase = world.lo.x + (x * cellSize);
2578 Real ybase = world.lo.y + (y * cellSize);
2579 const Real ROUGH_STEP_SIZE = MAP_XY_FACTOR; // no point in stepping smaller than grid scale
2580 Real numSteps = ceilf(cellSize / ROUGH_STEP_SIZE);
2581 Real step = cellSize / numSteps;
2582 loZ = HUGE_DIST; // huge positive
2583 hiZ = -HUGE_DIST; // huge negative
2584 for (Real yy = 0; yy <= cellSize; yy += step)
2585 {
2586 for (Real xx = 0; xx <= cellSize; xx += step)
2587 {
2588 Real h = TheTerrainLogic->getGroundHeight( xbase + xx, ybase + yy );
2589 if (h < loZ) loZ = h;
2590 if (h > hiZ) hiZ = h;
2591 }
2592 }
2593}
2594#endif
2595
2596//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2597void PartitionManager::init()
2598{
2599 m_cellSize = TheGlobalData->m_partitionCellSize;
2600 if (m_cellSize < 1.0)
2601 m_cellSize = 1.0;
2602
2603 m_cellSizeInv = (Real)(1.0 / m_cellSize);
2604
2605 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_cells == NULL, ("double init"));
2606
2607 if (TheTerrainLogic)
2608 {
2609 TheTerrainLogic->getExtent(&m_worldExtents);
2610 //DEBUG_ASSERTLOG(m_worldExtents.width() > 0 && m_worldExtents.height() > 0, ("TheTerrainLogic must be loaded before ThePartitionManager"));
2611 // you'd think it wouldn't be legal for terrainlogic to have zero area, but apparently
2612 // that's what it resets itself to. let's just make the world a simple place and pretend
2613 // it's nonzero in area, so that we can proceed without crashing.
2614 if (m_worldExtents.width() < 1.0f)
2615 m_worldExtents.hi.x = m_worldExtents.lo.x + 1.0f;
2616 if (m_worldExtents.height() < 1.0f)
2617 m_worldExtents.hi.y = m_worldExtents.lo.y + 1.0f;
2618 m_cellCountX = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL(m_worldExtents.width() * m_cellSizeInv);
2619 m_cellCountY = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL(m_worldExtents.height() * m_cellSizeInv);
2620 m_totalCellCount = m_cellCountX * m_cellCountY;
2621 m_cells = MSGNEW("PartitionManager_Cells") PartitionCell[m_totalCellCount];
2622 for (Int x = 0; x < m_cellCountX; x++)
2623 {
2624 for (Int y = 0; y < m_cellCountY; y++)
2625 {
2626#ifdef PM_CACHE_TERRAIN_HEIGHT
2627 Real loZ, hiZ;
2628 calcHeights(m_worldExtents, m_cellSize, x, y, loZ, hiZ);
2629 getCellAt(x, y)->init(x, y, loZ, hiZ);
2630#else
2631 getCellAt(x, y)->init(x, y);
2632#endif
2633 }
2634 }
2635
2636#ifdef FASTER_GCO
2637 calcRadiusVec();
2638#endif
2639
2640 }
2641 else
2642 {
2643 m_cellSize = m_cellSizeInv = 0.0f;
2644 m_cellCountX = 0;
2645 m_cellCountY = 0;
2646 m_totalCellCount = 0;
2647 m_cells = NULL;
2648 m_worldExtents.lo.zero();
2649 m_worldExtents.hi.zero();
2650 }
2651}
2652
2653//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2654#ifdef DUMP_PERF_STATS
2655void PartitionManager::getPMStats(double& gcoTimeThisFrameTotal, double& gcoTimeThisFrameAvg)
2656{
2657 Int64 freq64;
2658 GetPrecisionTimerTicksPerSec(&freq64);
2659
2660 double gcoTimeInMSecs = (double)s_timeInClosestObjectsThisFrame * 1000.0f / (double)freq64;
2661
2662 gcoTimeThisFrameTotal = gcoTimeInMSecs;
2663 gcoTimeThisFrameAvg = gcoTimeInMSecs / (double)s_countInClosestObjectsThisFrame;
2664}
2665#endif

2669{

2671 s_countInClosestObjects = 0;
2672 s_timeInClosestObjects = 0;
2673 s_countInClosestObjectsThisFrame = 0;
2674 s_timeInClosestObjectsThisFrame = 0;
2675 s_gcoPerfFrame = 0xffffffff;

2681 //init();

2684//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2685void PartitionManager::shutdown()
2686{
2687 m_updatedSinceLastReset = false;
2688 ThePartitionManager->removeAllDirtyModules();
2689
2690#ifdef _DEBUG
2691 // the above *should* remove all the touched cells (via unRegisterObject), but let's check:
2692 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( m_moduleList == NULL, ("hmm, modules left over"));
2693 PartitionData *mod, *nextMod;
2694 for( mod = m_moduleList; mod; mod = nextMod )
2695 {
2696 nextMod = mod->getNext();
2697 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(mod->friend_getCoiInUseCount() == 0, ("hmm, coi count mismatch"));
2698 mod->friend_removeAllTouchedCells();
2699 }
2700#endif
2701
2702#ifdef FASTER_GCO
2703 m_radiusVec.clear();
2704#endif
2705
2706 resetPendingUndoShroudRevealQueue();
2707
2708 delete [] m_cells;
2709 m_cells = NULL;
2710
2711 m_cellSize = m_cellSizeInv = 0.0f;
2712 m_cellCountX = 0;
2713 m_cellCountY = 0;
2714 m_totalCellCount = 0;
2715 m_worldExtents.lo.zero();
2716 m_worldExtents.hi.zero();
2717}
