2719//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2720//DECLARE_PERF_TIMER(PartitionManager_update)
2721void PartitionManager::update()
2722{
2723 //USE_PERF_TIMER(PartitionManager_update)
2724 {
2725#ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
2726 Int cc = 0;
2727#endif
2728 if (!m_updatedSinceLastReset)
2729 {
2730 m_updatedSinceLastReset = true;
2731 }
2732
2733 PartitionContactList ctList;
2734 TheContactList = &ctList;
2735 while (m_dirtyModules)
2736 {
2737#ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
2738 ++cc;
2739#endif
2740
2741 // save it.
2742 PartitionData *dirty = m_dirtyModules;
2743 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(dirty->getObject() != NULL || dirty->getGhostObject() != NULL,
2744 ("must be attached to an Object here %08lx",dirty));
2745
2746 // get this BEFORE removing from dirty list, since that clears the
2747 // flag in question.
2748 Bool updateEm = dirty->isInNeedOfUpdatingCells();
2749 Bool collideEm = dirty->isInNeedOfCollisionCheck() && dirty->getObject(); //only update collisions if we have object
2750
2751 // detach it from the dirty list.
2752 removeFromDirtyModules(dirty);
2753
2754 if (updateEm)
2755 {
2756 dirty->friend_updateCellsTouched();
2757 }
2758
2759 if (collideEm && !dirty->getObject()->isKindOf(KINDOF_IMMOBILE))
2760 {
2761 dirty->addPossibleCollisions(&ctList);
2762 }
2763 }
2764
2765 ctList.processContactList();
2766#ifdef INTENSE_DEBUG
2767 DEBUG_ASSERTLOG(cc==0,("updated partition info for %d objects\n",cc));
2768#endif
2769 TheContactList = NULL;
2770
2771 processPendingUndoShroudRevealQueue();
2772 }
2773
2774#if defined(_DEBUG) || defined(_INTERNAL)
2775 if (TheGlobalData->m_debugThreatMap)
2776 {
2777 if (TheGameLogic->getFrame() % TheGlobalData->m_debugThreatMapTileDuration)
2778 {
2779 Int cellCount = m_cellCountX * m_cellCountY;
2780 for (int i = 0; i < cellCount; ++i)
2781 {
2782 UnsignedInt threat = m_cells[i].getThreatValue(ThePlayerList->getLocalPlayer()->getPlayerIndex());
2783 if (threat > 0)
2784 {
2785 Real threatMul = INT_TO_REAL(threat) / TheGlobalData->m_maxDebugThreat;
2786 if (threatMul > 1.0f)
2787 threatMul = 1.0f;
2788
2789 Real size = TheGlobalData->m_partitionCellSize;
2790 Coord3D pos = { m_cells[i].getCellX() * size,
2791 m_cells[i].getCellY() * size,
2792 0 };
2793 pos.z = TheTerrainLogic->getGroundHeight(pos.x, pos.y);
2794 RGBColor color;
2795 color.red = threatMul;
2796 color.blue = 0.0f;
2797 color.green = 0.0f;
2798
2799 addIcon(&pos, size, TheGlobalData->m_debugThreatMapTileDuration, color);
2800 }
2801 }
2802 }
2803 }
2804
2805 if (TheGlobalData->m_debugCashValueMap)
2806 {
2807 if (TheGameLogic->getFrame() % TheGlobalData->m_debugCashValueMapTileDuration)
2808 {
2809 Int cellCount = m_cellCountX * m_cellCountY;
2810 for (int i = 0; i < cellCount; ++i)
2811 {
2812 UnsignedInt value = m_cells[i].getCashValue(ThePlayerList->getLocalPlayer()->getPlayerIndex());
2813 if (value > 0)
2814 {
2815 Real valueMul = INT_TO_REAL(value) / TheGlobalData->m_maxDebugValue;
2816 if (valueMul > 1.0f)
2817 valueMul = 1.0f;
2818
2819 Real size = TheGlobalData->m_partitionCellSize;
2820 Coord3D pos = { m_cells[i].getCellX() * size,
2821 m_cells[i].getCellY() * size,
2822 0 };
2823 pos.z = TheTerrainLogic->getGroundHeight(pos.x, pos.y);
2824 RGBColor color;
2825 color.red = 0.0f;
2826 color.blue = 0.0f;
2827 color.green = valueMul;
2828
2829 addIcon(&pos, size, TheGlobalData->m_debugCashValueMapTileDuration, color);
2830 }
2831 }
2832 }
2833 }
2834#endif // defined(_DEBUG) || defined(_INTERNAL)
2835} // end update
2836
2837//------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2838void PartitionManager::registerObject( Object* object )
2839{
2840 // sanity
2841 if( object == NULL )
2842 return;
2843
2844 // if object is already part of this system get out of here
2845 if( object->friend_getPartitionData() != NULL )
2846 {
2847 DEBUG_LOG(( "Object '%s' already registered with partition manager\n",
2848 object->getTemplate()->getName().str() ));
2849 return;
2850 } // end if
2851
2852 // allocate a new module of partition data
2853 PartitionData *mod = newInstance( PartitionData );
2854
2855 // link the module to the list in the partition manager
2856 mod->setPrev( NULL );
2857 mod->setNext( m_moduleList );
2858 if( m_moduleList )
2859 m_moduleList->setPrev( mod );
2860 m_moduleList = mod;
2861
2862 // add module to object
2863 mod->attachToObject( object );
2864
2865}
2866
2867//------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2868void PartitionManager::unRegisterObject( Object* object )
2869{
2870 // sanity
2871 if( object == NULL )
2872 return;
2873
2874 // get the partition module
2875 PartitionData *mod = object->friend_getPartitionData();
2876 if( mod == NULL )
2877 return;
2878
2879 GhostObject *ghost;
2880
2881 // need to figure out if any players have a fogged memory of this object.
2882 // if so, we can't remove it from the shroud system just yet.
2883 if ((ghost=mod->getGhostObject()) != NULL && mod->wasSeenByAnyPlayers() < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT)
2884 {
2885 if (TheContactList)
2886 TheContactList->removeSpecificPartitionData(mod);
2887 object->friend_setPartitionData(NULL);
2888 mod->friend_setObject(NULL);
2889 //Tell the ghost object that its parent is dead.
2890 ghost->updateParentObject(NULL, mod);
2891 return;
2892 }
2893
2894 // detach the module from the object
2895 mod->detachFromObject();
2896
2897 // remove module from master list
2898 PartitionData *next = mod->getNext();
2899 PartitionData *prev = mod->getPrev();
2900 if( next )
2901 next->setPrev( prev );
2902 if( prev )
2903 prev->setNext( next );
2904 else
2905 m_moduleList = next;
2906
2907 // delete module
2908 mod->deleteInstance();
2909
2910}
2911
2912//------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2913void PartitionManager::registerGhostObject( GhostObject* object)
2914{
2915 // sanity
2916 if( object == NULL )
2917 return;
2918
2919 // if object is already part of this system get out of here
2920 if( object->friend_getPartitionData() != NULL )
2921 {
2922 DEBUG_LOG(( "GhostObject already registered with partition manager\n"));
2923 return;
2924 } // end if
2925
2926 // allocate a new module of partition data
2927 PartitionData *mod = newInstance( PartitionData );
2928
2929 // link the module to the list in the partition manager
2930 mod->setPrev( NULL );
2931 mod->setNext( m_moduleList );
2932 if( m_moduleList )
2933 m_moduleList->setPrev( mod );
2934 m_moduleList = mod;
2935
2936 // add module to object
2937 mod->attachToGhostObject( object);
2938}
2939
2940//------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2941void PartitionManager::unRegisterGhostObject( GhostObject* object )
2942{
2943 // sanity
2944 if( object == NULL )
2945 return;
2946
2947 // get the partition module
2948 PartitionData *mod = object->friend_getPartitionData();
2949 if( mod == NULL )
2950 return;
2951
2952 // detach the module from the object
2953 mod->detachFromGhostObject();
2954
2955 // remove module from master list
2956 PartitionData *next = mod->getNext();
2957 PartitionData *prev = mod->getPrev();
2958 if( next )
2959 next->setPrev( prev );
2960 if( prev )
2961 prev->setNext( next );
2962 else
2963 m_moduleList = next;
2964
2965 // delete module
2966 mod->deleteInstance();
2967}
2968
2972void PartitionManager::revealMapForPlayer( Int playerIndex )
2973{
2974 // By looking and then stopping on every cell, I clear all Passive Shroud
2975 // By adding a looker directly I don't hit the Ally logic of the normal look/doShroudReveal
2976 for (int i = 0; i < m_totalCellCount; ++i)
2977 {
2978 m_cells[i].addLooker( playerIndex );
2979 m_cells[i].removeLooker( playerIndex );
2980 }
2981}
2982
2986void PartitionManager::revealMapForPlayerPermanently( Int playerIndex )
2987{
2988 // By skipping the removeLooker, I consider myself as actively looking at everything,
2989 // so Shroud generation will no longer function
2990 // By adding a looker directly I don't hit the Ally logic of the normal look/doShroudReveal
2991 for (int i = 0; i < m_totalCellCount; ++i)
2992 {
2993 m_cells[i].addLooker( playerIndex );
2994 }
2995}
2996
3000void PartitionManager::undoRevealMapForPlayerPermanently( Int playerIndex )
3001{
3002 //First make sure no lingering looks will leave holes when they aren't wanted.
3003 processEntirePendingUndoShroudRevealQueue();
3004
3005 // This will have amusing consequences if done without a preceding revealMapForPlayerPermanently.
3006 // Everything you own can become shrouded.
3007 for (int i = 0; i < m_totalCellCount; ++i)
3008 {
3009 m_cells[i].removeLooker( playerIndex );
3010 }
3011}
3012
3016void PartitionManager::shroudMapForPlayer( Int playerIndex )
3017{
3018 //First make sure no lingering looks will leave holes when they aren't wanted.
3019 processEntirePendingUndoShroudRevealQueue();
3020
3021 // By pulsing a blast of shroud like this, we will set everything not actively looked at as Passive Shroud
3022 for (int i = 0; i < m_totalCellCount; ++i)
3023 {
3024 m_cells[i].addShrouder( playerIndex );
3025 m_cells[i].removeShrouder( playerIndex );
3026 }
3027}
3028
3029//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3030void PartitionManager::refreshShroudForLocalPlayer()
3031{
3032 // This is a drawing refresh only, and so is allowed to use the Local Player.
3033 TheDisplay->clearShroud();
3034 TheRadar->clearShroud();
3035
3036 Int playerIndex = ThePlayerList->getLocalPlayer()->getPlayerIndex();
3037 for (int i = 0; i < m_totalCellCount; ++i)
3038 {
3039 Int x = m_cells[i].getCellX();
3040 Int y = m_cells[i].getCellY();
3041 CellShroudStatus status = m_cells[i].getShroudStatusForPlayer(playerIndex);
3042 TheDisplay->setShroudLevel(x, y, status);
3043 TheRadar->setShroudLevel(x, y, status);
3044 m_cells[i].invalidateShroudedStatusForAllCois(playerIndex);
3045 }
3046}

3048//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3049CellShroudStatus PartitionManager::getShroudStatusForPlayer(Int playerIndex, Int x, Int y) const
3050{
3051 if( playerIndex < 0 )
3052 return CELLSHROUD_SHROUDED;// Safety. There are no Negative players, but PlayerIndex is typedef'd to Int, not UnsignedInt
3053
3054 const PartitionCell* cell = getCellAt(x, y);
3055 return cell ? cell->getShroudStatusForPlayer(playerIndex) : CELLSHROUD_SHROUDED;
3056}
3057
3058//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3059CellShroudStatus PartitionManager::getShroudStatusForPlayer(Int playerIndex, const Coord3D *loc ) const
3060{
3061 Int x, y;
3062
3063 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell( loc->x, loc->y, &x, &y );
3064
3065 return getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex, x, y );
3066}
3067
3068
3069//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3070ObjectShroudStatus PartitionManager::getPropShroudStatusForPlayer(Int playerIndex, const Coord3D *loc ) const
3071{
3072 Int x, y;
3073
3074 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell( loc->x - m_cellSize*0.5f, loc->y - m_cellSize*0.5f, &x, &y );
3075
3076 CellShroudStatus cellStat = getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex, x, y );
3077 if (cellStat != getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex, x+1, y )) {
3078 return OBJECTSHROUD_PARTIAL_CLEAR;
3079 }
3080 if (cellStat != getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex, x+1, y+1 )) {
3081 return OBJECTSHROUD_PARTIAL_CLEAR;
3082 }
3083 if (cellStat != getShroudStatusForPlayer( playerIndex, x, y+1 )) {
3084 return OBJECTSHROUD_PARTIAL_CLEAR;
3085 }
3086 if (cellStat == CELLSHROUD_SHROUDED) {
3087 return OBJECTSHROUD_SHROUDED;
3088 }
3089 if (cellStat == CELLSHROUD_CLEAR) {
3090 return OBJECTSHROUD_CLEAR;
3091 }
3092 return OBJECTSHROUD_FOGGED;
3093}

3096
3097#ifdef FASTER_GCO
3098//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3099Int PartitionManager::calcMinRadius(const ICoord2D& cur)
3100{
3101 /*
3102 ok, so if obj "A" is in cell (0,0), and obj "B"
3103 is in cell (cur.x, cur.y), calc the smallest distance they could be
3104 from each other, in integral multiples of cellSize. Note that
3105 each object can be anywhere within a given cell (not just in the center!)
3106 so even objects in the same cell can still be cellSize*1.414 apart,
3107 and objects in adjacent cells can be nearly-zero distance apart!
3108 */
3109 Real halfCell = m_cellSize * 0.5;
3110 Coord3D centerPos[4] =
3111 {
3112 { -halfCell, -halfCell },
3113 { halfCell, -halfCell },
3114 { -halfCell, halfCell },
3115 { halfCell, halfCell }
3116 };
3117
3118 Real x = cur.x * m_cellSize;
3119 Real y = cur.y * m_cellSize;
3120 Coord3D otherPos[4] =
3121 {
3122 { x - halfCell, y - halfCell },
3123 { x + halfCell, y - halfCell },
3124 { x - halfCell, y + halfCell },
3125 { x + halfCell, y + halfCell }
3126 };
3127
3128 /*
3129 this is ugly and there's probably a faster way, but we only do this once per PM reset,
3130 so it really shouldn't matter... (I hope)
3131 */
3132
3133 double minDistSqr = 1e12; // double, not real
3134 for (int i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
3135 {
3136 for (int j = 0; j < 4; ++j)
3137 {
3138 // double, not real
3139 double dx = centerPos[i].x - otherPos[j].x;
3140 double dy = centerPos[i].y - otherPos[j].y;
3141 double curDistSqr = dx*dx + dy*dy;
3142 if (minDistSqr > curDistSqr)
3143 minDistSqr = curDistSqr;
3144 }
3145 }
3146
3147 // double, not real
3148 double dist = sqrtf(minDistSqr);
3149 Int minRadius = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL( dist / m_cellSize );
3150
3151 return minRadius;
3152}
3153#endif
3154
3155#ifdef FASTER_GCO
3156//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3157void PartitionManager::calcRadiusVec()
3158{
3159 Real cellSize = getCellSize();
3160 Int cx = getCellCountX();
3161 Int cy = getCellCountY();
3162
3163 // double, not real
3164 double dx = (double)cx * (double)cellSize;
3165 double dy = (double)cy * (double)cellSize;
3166 double maxPossibleDist = sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy);
3167
3168 m_maxGcoRadius = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL(maxPossibleDist / cellSize);
3169
3170 m_radiusVec.clear();
3171 m_radiusVec.resize(m_maxGcoRadius+1, OffsetVec());
3172
3173 ICoord2D cur;
3174 for (cur.y = -cy+1; cur.y < cy; ++cur.y)
3175 {
3176 for (cur.x = -cx+1; cur.x < cx; ++cur.x)
3177 {
3178 /*
3179 m_radiusVec[curRadius] contains a list of the cells (foo) that could
3180 contain objects that are <= (curRadius * cellSize) distance away from cell (0,0).
3181 */
3182 Int curRadius = calcMinRadius(cur);
3183 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(curRadius <= m_maxGcoRadius, ("expected max of %d but got %d\n",m_maxGcoRadius,curRadius));
3184 if (curRadius <= m_maxGcoRadius)
3185 m_radiusVec[curRadius].push_back(cur);
3186 }
3187 }
3188
3189#if defined(_DEBUG) || defined(_INTERNAL)
3190 Int total = 0;
3191 for (Int i = 0; i <= m_maxGcoRadius; ++i)
3192 {
3193 total += m_radiusVec[i].size();
3194 //DEBUG_LOG(("radius %d has %d entries\n",i,m_radiusVec[i].size()));
3195 }
3196 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(total == (cx*2-1)*(cy*2-1),("expected %d, got %d\n",(cx*2-1)*(cy*2-1),total));
3197#endif
3198
3199}
3200#endif
3201
3202//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3203//DECLARE_PERF_TIMER(getClosestObjects)
3204Object *PartitionManager::getClosestObjects(
3205 const Object *obj,
3206 const Coord3D *pos,
3207 Real maxDist,
3208 DistanceCalculationType dc,
3209 PartitionFilter **filters,
3210 SimpleObjectIterator *iterArg, // if nonnull, append ALL satisfactory objects to the iterator (not just the single closest)
3211 Real *closestDistArg,
3212 Coord3D *closestVecArg
3213)
3214{
3215 //USE_PERF_TIMER(getClosestObjects)
3216
3217#ifdef DUMP_PERF_STATS
3218 if (TheGameLogic->getFrame() != s_gcoPerfFrame)
3219 {
3220 s_gcoPerfFrame = TheGameLogic->getFrame();
3221 s_countInClosestObjectsThisFrame = 0;
3222 s_timeInClosestObjectsThisFrame = 0;
3223 }
3224 ++s_countInClosestObjects;
3225 ++s_countInClosestObjectsThisFrame;
3226
3227 Int64 startTime64;
3228 GetPrecisionTimer(&startTime64);
3229#endif
3230
3231#ifdef _DEBUG
3232 static Int theEntrancyCount = 0;
3233 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(theEntrancyCount == 0, ("sorry, this routine is not reentrant"));
3234 ++theEntrancyCount;
3235#endif
3236
3237 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH((obj==NULL) != (pos == NULL), ("either obj or pos must be null"));
3238
3239 DistCalcProc distProc = theDistCalcProcs[dc];
3240
3241 const Coord3D *objPos;
3242 const Object *objToUse;
3243 if (pos)
3244 {
3245 objPos = pos;
3246 objToUse = NULL;
3247 }
3248 else
3249 {
3250 objPos = obj->getPosition();
3251 objToUse = obj;
3252 }
3253 Int cellCenterX, cellCenterY;
3254 worldToCell(objPos->x, objPos->y, &cellCenterX, &cellCenterY);
3255
3256 Object* closestObj = NULL;
3257 Real closestDistSqr = maxDist * maxDist; // if it's not closer than this, we shouldn't consider it anyway...
3258 Coord3D closestVec;
3259
3260#ifdef FASTER_GCO
3261
3262 Int maxRadius = m_maxGcoRadius;
3263 if (maxDist < HUGE_DIST)
3264 {
3265 // don't go outwards any farther than necessary.
3266 maxRadius = minInt(m_maxGcoRadius, worldToCellDist(maxDist));
3267 }
3268#if defined(INTENSE_DEBUG)
3269 /*
3270 Note, if you ever enable this code, be forewarned that it can give
3271 you "false positives" for objects that are located just off the map... (srj)
3272 */
3273 Int maxRadiusLimit = maxRadius + 3;
3274 if (maxRadiusLimit > m_maxGcoRadius) maxRadiusLimit = m_maxGcoRadius;
3275#else
3276 Int maxRadiusLimit = maxRadius;
3277#endif
3278
3279 Bool foundAny = false;
3280
3281 static Int theIterFlag = 1; // nonzero, thanks
3282 ++theIterFlag;
3283
3284 /*
3285 m_radiusVec[curRadius] contains a list of the cells (foo) that could
3286 contain objects that are <= (curRadius * cellSize) distance away from cell (0,0).
3287 */
3288 for (Int curRadius = 0; curRadius <= maxRadiusLimit; ++curRadius)
3289 {
3290 const OffsetVec& offsets = m_radiusVec[curRadius];
3291 if (offsets.empty())
3292 continue;
3293 for (OffsetVec::const_iterator it = offsets.begin(); it != offsets.end(); ++it)
3294 {
3295 PartitionCell* thisCell = getCellAt(cellCenterX + it->x, cellCenterY + it->y);
3296 if (thisCell == NULL)
3297 continue;
3298
3299 for (CellAndObjectIntersection *thisCoi = thisCell->getFirstCoiInCell(); thisCoi; thisCoi = thisCoi->getNextCoi())
3300 {
3301 PartitionData *thisMod = thisCoi->getModule();
3302 Object *thisObj = thisMod->getObject();
3303
3304 // never compare against ourself.
3305 if (thisObj == obj || thisObj == NULL)
3306 continue;
3307
3308 // since an object can exist in multiple COIs, we use this to avoid processing
3309 // the same one more than once.
3310 if (thisMod->friend_getDoneFlag() == theIterFlag)
3311 continue;
3312 thisMod->friend_setDoneFlag(theIterFlag);
3313
3314 Real thisDistSqr;
3315 Coord3D distVec;
3316 if (!(*distProc)(objPos, objToUse, thisObj->getPosition(), thisObj, thisDistSqr, distVec, closestDistSqr))
3317 continue;
3318
3319 if (!filtersAllow(filters, thisObj))
3320 continue;
3321
3322 // ok, this is within the range, and the filters allow it.
3323 // add it to the iter, if we have one....
3324 if (iterArg)
3325 {
3326 iterArg->insert(thisObj, thisDistSqr);
3327 }
3328 else
3329 {
3330 // hey, this is the new closest object! cool.
3331 // (note that we can't break out now 'cuz we have to finish examining the
3332 // rest of curRadius)
3333 closestObj = thisObj;
3334 closestDistSqr = thisDistSqr;
3335 closestVec = distVec;
3336
3337 if (!foundAny)
3338 {
3339 // if not adding to iterArg, we want to stop once we have the closest object.
3340 maxRadiusLimit = curRadius;
3341 }
3342 foundAny = true;
3343 }
3344
3345 } // next coi
3346 } // next cell in this radius
3347 } // next radius
3348
3349#else // not FASTER_GCO
3350
3351 CellOutwardIterator iter(this, cellCenterX, cellCenterY);
3352 if (maxDist < HUGE_DIST)
3353 {
3354 // don't go outwards any farther than necessary.
3355 Int max = worldToCellDist(maxDist) + 1;
3356 // default value for "max" is largest possible, based on map size, so we should
3357 // never make it any larger than that
3358 if (max < iter.getMaxRadius())
3359 iter.setMaxRadius(max);
3360 }
3361
3362 Bool foundAny = false;
3363
3364 static Int theIterFlag = 1; // nonzero, thanks
3365 ++theIterFlag;
3366
3367 PartitionCell *thisCell;
3368 while ((thisCell = iter.nextNonEmpty()) != NULL)
3369 {
3370 CellAndObjectIntersection *nextCoi;
3371 for (CellAndObjectIntersection *thisCoi = thisCell->getFirstCoiInCell(); thisCoi; thisCoi = nextCoi)
3372 {
3373 nextCoi = thisCoi->getNextCoi();
3374
3375 PartitionData *thisMod = thisCoi->getModule();
3376
3377 Object *thisObj = thisMod->getObject();
3378
3379 // never compare against ourself.
3380 if (thisObj == obj)
3381 continue;
3382
3383 if (thisMod->friend_getDoneFlag() == theIterFlag)
3384 continue;
3385
3386 thisMod->friend_setDoneFlag(theIterFlag);
3387
3388 // hmm, ok, calc the distance.
3389 Real thisDistSqr;
3390 Coord3D distVec;
3391 if (!(*distProc)(objPos, objToUse, thisObj->getPosition(), thisObj, &thisDistSqr, &distVec, closestDistSqr))
3392 continue;
3393
3394 // check the filters now
3395 if (!filtersAllow(filters, thisObj))
3396 continue;
3397
3398 // ok, guess this is a winner!
3399 if (iterArg)
3400 {
3401 iterArg->insert(thisObj, thisDistSqr);
3402 }
3403 else
3404 {
3405 closestObj = thisObj;
3406 closestDistSqr = thisDistSqr;
3407 closestVec = distVec;
3408
3409 if (!foundAny)
3410 {
3411 // if not adding to iterArg, we want to stop once we have the closest object.
3412 // since all objects in this radius (and the next radius, due to slop) might
3413 // be slightly closer, we still have to check all of them. so set the termination
3414 // radius to be our-current-radius-plus-1. (if we ARE adding to the iterArg, we skip
3415 // this, cuz we want to go all the way out to the original max we specified as an arg.)
3416 iter.setMaxRadius(iter.getCurCellRadius() + 2);
3417 }
3418 foundAny = true;
3419 }
3420 }
3421 }
3422
3423#endif // not FASTER_GCO
3424
3425 if (closestVecArg)
3426 {
3427 *closestVecArg = closestVec;
3428 }
3429 if (closestDistArg)
3430 {
3431 *closestDistArg = (Real)sqrtf(closestDistSqr);
3432 }
3433
3434#ifdef _DEBUG
3435 --theEntrancyCount;
3436#endif
3437#ifdef DUMP_PERF_STATS
3438 Int64 endTime64;
3439 GetPrecisionTimer(&endTime64);
3440 Int64 delta = (endTime64 - startTime64);
3441 s_timeInClosestObjects += delta;
3442 s_timeInClosestObjectsThisFrame += delta;
3443#endif
3444
3445 return closestObj; // might be null...
3446}

3543{
3544 return getRelativeAngle2D(obj, otherObj->getPosition());
3545}
3546
3547//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3548Real PartitionManager::getRelativeAngle2D( const Object *obj, const Coord3D *pos )
3549{
3550 Coord3D v;
3551
3552 // compute vector to given position
3553 Coord3D objPos = *obj->getPosition();
3554 v.x = pos->x - objPos.x;
3555 v.y = pos->y - objPos.y;
3556 v.z = 0.0f;
3557
3558 Real dist = (Real)sqrtf(sqr(v.x) + sqr(v.y));
3559
3560 // normalize
3561 if (dist == 0.0f)
3562 return 0.0f;
3563
3564
3565 const Coord3D *dir = obj->getUnitDirectionVector2D();
3566
3567 Real distInv = 1.0f / dist;
3568 v.x *= distInv;
3569 v.y *= distInv;
3570 v.z *= distInv;
3571
3572 // dot of two unit vectors is cos of angle
3573 Real c = dir->x*v.x + dir->y*v.y; // + dir->z*v.z;
3574
3575 // bound it in case of numerical error
3576 if (c < -1.0)
3577 c = -1.0;
3578 else if (c > 1.0)
3579 c = 1.0;
3580
3581 Real value = (Real)ACos( c );
3582
3583 // Determine sign by checking Z component of dir cross v
3584 // Note this is assumes 2D, and is identical to dotting the perpendicular of v with dir
3585 Real perpZ = dir->x * v.y - dir->y * v.x;
3586 if (perpZ < 0.0f)
3587 value = -value;
3588
3589 // note: to make this 3D, 'dir' and 'v' can be normalized and dotted just as they are
3590 // to test sign, compute N = dir X v, then P = N x dir, then S = P . v, where sign of
3591 // S is sign of angle - MSB
3592
3593 return value;
3594}

3597SimpleObjectIterator *PartitionManager::iterateObjectsInRange(
3598 const Object *obj,
3599 Real maxDist,
3600 DistanceCalculationType dc,
3601 PartitionFilter **filters,
3602 IterOrderType order
3603)
3604{

3607 iterHolder.hold(iter);
3608
3609 getClosestObjects(obj, NULL, maxDist, dc, filters, iter, NULL, NULL);

3612 iterHolder.release();
3613 return iter;

3636//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3637SimpleObjectIterator* PartitionManager::iteratePotentialCollisions(
3638 const Coord3D* pos,
3639 const GeometryInfo& geom,
3640 Real angle,
3641 Bool use2D
3642)
3643{
3644 Real maxDist = geom.getBoundingSphereRadius();
3645 maxDist *= 1.1f; // just a little slop
3646
3647 MemoryPoolObjectHolder iterHolder;
3648 SimpleObjectIterator *iter = newInstance(SimpleObjectIterator);
3649 iterHolder.hold(iter);
3650
3651 PartitionFilterWouldCollide filter(*pos, geom, angle, true);
3652 PartitionFilter *filters[] = { &filter, NULL };
3653
3654 getClosestObjects(NULL, pos, maxDist, use2D ? FROM_BOUNDINGSPHERE_2D : FROM_BOUNDINGSPHERE_3D, filters, iter, NULL, NULL);
3655
3656 iterHolder.release();
3657 return iter;
3658}
3659
3660//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3661Bool PartitionManager::isColliding( const Object *a, const Object *b ) const
3662{
3663 //Make sure we have objects
3664 if( !a || !b )
3665 {
3666 return false;
3667 }
3668
3669 //Get both object's partition data
3670 const PartitionData* ad = a->friend_getConstPartitionData();
3671 const PartitionData* bd = b->friend_getConstPartitionData();
3672
3673 //Make sure we got it
3674 if( !ad || !bd )
3675 {
3676 return false;
3677 }
3678
3679 //See if the partition data collides.
3680 return ad->friend_collidesWith( bd, NULL );
3681}
3682
3683//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3684SimpleObjectIterator *PartitionManager::iterateAllObjects(PartitionFilter **filters)
3685{
3686 MemoryPoolObjectHolder iterHolder;
3687 SimpleObjectIterator *iter = newInstance(SimpleObjectIterator);
3688 iterHolder.hold(iter);
3689
3690 // no distance constraints; we're gonna have to process 'em all anyway,
3691 // so go thru in the fastest way we know how.
3692 PartitionData *mod, *nextMod;
3693 for( mod = m_moduleList; mod; mod = nextMod )
3694 {
3695 nextMod = mod->getNext();
3696 Object *obj = mod->getObject();
3697 if (obj && filtersAllow(filters, obj))
3698 {
3699 iter->insert( obj );
3700 }
3701 }
3702
3703 iterHolder.release();
3704 return iter;
3705}
3706
3707// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3708// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3709Bool PartitionManager::tryPosition( const Coord3D *center,
3710 Real dist,
3711 Real angle,
3712 const FindPositionOptions *options,
3713 Coord3D *result )
3714{
3715
3716 // compute the spot on the terrain we've picked
3717 Coord3D pos;
3718 pos.x = dist * Cos( angle ) + center->x;
3719 pos.y = dist * Sin( angle ) + center->y;
3720
3721 PathfindLayerEnum layer = LAYER_GROUND;
3722 if ((options->flags & FPF_USE_HIGHEST_LAYER) != 0)
3723 {
3724 pos.z = 99999.0f;
3725 layer = TheTerrainLogic->getHighestLayerForDestination(&pos);
3726 pos.z = TheTerrainLogic->getLayerHeight(pos.x, pos.y, layer);
3727 // ensure we are slightly above the bridge, to account for fudge & sloppy art
3728 if (layer != LAYER_GROUND)
3729 pos.z += 1.0f;
3730 }
3731 else
3732 {
3733 pos.z = TheTerrainLogic->getGroundHeight( pos.x, pos.y );
3734 }
3735
3736 if (fabs(pos.z - center->z) > options->maxZDelta)
3737 return FALSE;
3738
3739 //
3740 // we don't usually find positions on cliffs.
3741 // someday, add bit options for this, like for water.
3742 //
3743 if (TheTerrainLogic->isCliffCell(pos.x, pos.y) && layer == LAYER_GROUND)
3744 return FALSE;
3745
3746 //
3747 // srj sez:
3748 // we don't usually find positions on impassable areas.
3749 // someday, add bit options for this, like for water.
3750 //
3751 {
3752 Int cellX = REAL_TO_INT_FLOOR(pos.x / PATHFIND_CELL_SIZE);
3753 Int cellY = REAL_TO_INT_FLOOR(pos.y / PATHFIND_CELL_SIZE);
3754 PathfindCell* cell = TheAI->pathfinder()->getCell(layer, cellX, cellY);
3755 if (!cell || cell->getType() == PathfindCell::CELL_IMPASSABLE)
3756 {
3757 return FALSE;
3758 }
3759 if( BitTest(options->flags, FPF_CLEAR_CELLS_ONLY) && cell->getType() != PathfindCell::CELL_CLEAR )
3760 return FALSE;
3761
3762 }
3763
3764 //
3765 // we don't usually find positions in the water unless we explicitly say that's OK,
3766 // or if the option is set we can only pick position underwater
3767 //
3768 if( BitTest( options->flags, FPF_IGNORE_WATER ) == FALSE )
3769 {
3770 Bool isUnderwater = TheTerrainLogic->isUnderwater( pos.x, pos.y );
3771
3772 //
3773 // if we want water spots only and this is underwater it's no good, otherwise we want
3774 // the default behavior where underwater spots are invalid
3775 //
3776 if( BitTest( options->flags, FPF_WATER_ONLY ) && (isUnderwater == FALSE || layer != LAYER_GROUND) )
3777 return FALSE;
3778 else if( isUnderwater == TRUE && layer == LAYER_GROUND )
3779 return FALSE;
3780
3781 } // end if
3782
3783 // object checks
3784 if( BitTest( options->flags, FPF_IGNORE_ALL_OBJECTS ) == FALSE )
3785 {
3786
3787 //
3788 // iterate the potential collisions at this location using a
3789 // very small sphere geometry around the point
3790 //
3791 GeometryInfo geometry( GEOMETRY_SPHERE, TRUE, 5.0f, 5.0f, 5.0f );
3792 ObjectIterator *iter = ThePartitionManager->iteratePotentialCollisions( &pos, geometry, angle, true );
3793 MemoryPoolObjectHolder hold( iter );
3794// Bool overlap = FALSE;
3795
3796 for( Object *them = iter->first(); them; them = iter->next() )
3797 {
3798
3799 // if this is the ignore object, ignore it
3800 if( them == options->ignoreObject )
3801 continue; // continue in the object iterator for loop
3802
3803 // relationship checks
3804 if( options->relationshipObject )
3805 {
3806
3807 // if this is an ally/neutral unit and we ignore those, do so
3808 if( BitTest( options->flags, FPF_IGNORE_ALLY_OR_NEUTRAL_UNITS ) == TRUE &&
3809 options->relationshipObject->getRelationship( them ) != ENEMIES &&
3810 (them->isKindOf( KINDOF_INFANTRY ) || them->isKindOf( KINDOF_VEHICLE )) )
3811 continue;
3812
3813 // if this is an ally/neutral structure and we ignore those, do so
3814 if( BitTest( options->flags, FPF_IGNORE_ALLY_OR_NEUTRAL_STRUCTURES ) == TRUE &&
3815 options->relationshipObject->getRelationship( them ) != ENEMIES &&
3816 them->isKindOf( KINDOF_STRUCTURE ) )
3817 continue;
3818
3819 // if this is an enemy unit and we ignore those, do so
3820 if( BitTest( options->flags, FPF_IGNORE_ENEMY_UNITS ) == TRUE &&
3821 options->relationshipObject->getRelationship( them ) == ENEMIES &&
3822 (them->isKindOf( KINDOF_INFANTRY ) || them->isKindOf( KINDOF_VEHICLE )) )
3823 continue;
3824
3825 // if this is an enemy structure and we ignore those, do so
3826 if( BitTest( options->flags, FPF_IGNORE_ENEMY_STRUCTURES ) == TRUE &&
3827 options->relationshipObject->getRelationship( them ) == ENEMIES &&
3828 them->isKindOf( KINDOF_STRUCTURE ) )
3829 continue;
3830
3831 } // end if, relationship checks
3832
3833 //
3834 // if we have a source that must path to the destination we will ignore that too
3835 // NOTE: If needed, we can reorganize the meaning of this method to be
3836 // more explicit on when to pay attention to any 'source' objects and when not too
3837 // but for now we're keeping the API very simple for the kinds of queries
3838 // that we're likely to do for an RTS (CBD)
3839 //
3840 if( them == options->sourceToPathToDest )
3841 continue; // continue in the object iterator for loop
3842
3843 // oops, we have overlapped something
3844 return FALSE;
3845
3846 } // end for, them
3847
3848 } // end if
3849
3850 //
3851 // finally ... if sourceToPathDest is valid ... the source object must be able to
3852 // find a path the the position we have selected. We want to do this last because
3853 // a pathfind can sometimes be an relatively expensive operation
3854 //
3855 if( options->sourceToPathToDest )
3856 {
3857 const AIUpdateInterface *ai = options->sourceToPathToDest->getAIUpdateInterface();
3858
3859 // check for path existence
3860 if( ai && TheAI->pathfinder()->clientSafeQuickDoesPathExist( ai->getLocomotorSet(),
3861 options->sourceToPathToDest->getPosition(),
3862 &pos ) == FALSE )
3863 return FALSE;
3864
3865 } // end if
3866
3867 // save result and return TRUE for position found
3868 *result = pos;
3869 return TRUE;
3870
3871} // end tryPosition
3872
3873//
3874// the following determines how fast we expand our concentric ring search for the
3875// find position methods
3876//
3877static Real ringSpacing = 5.0f;
3878
3879//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3886//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3887Bool PartitionManager::findPositionAround( const Coord3D *center,
3888 const FindPositionOptions *options,
3889 Coord3D *result )
3890{
3891
3892 // sanity
3893 if( center == NULL || result == NULL || options == NULL )
3894 return FALSE;
3895
3896 Region3D extent;
3897 TheTerrainLogic->getMaximumPathfindExtent(&extent);
3898 // If the goal is off the map, it is a scripted setup, so just
3899 // use the center.
3900 if (!extent.isInRegionNoZ(center)) {
3901 *result = *center;
3902 return true;
3903 }
3904 // sanity, FPF_IGNORE_WATER and FPF_WATER_ONLY are mutually exclusive
3905 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH( !(BitTest( options->flags, FPF_IGNORE_WATER ) == TRUE &&
3906 BitTest( options->flags, FPF_WATER_ONLY ) == TRUE),
3907 ("PartitionManager::findPositionAround - The options FPF_WATER_ONLY and FPF_IGNORE_WATER are mutually exclusive. You cannot use them together\n") );
3908
3909 // pick a random angle from the center location to start at
3910 Real startAngle;
3911 if( options->startAngle == RANDOM_START_ANGLE )
3912 startAngle = GameLogicRandomValueReal( 0.0f, TWO_PI );
3913 else
3914 startAngle = options->startAngle;
3915
3916 // start the search at the most inner ring (minRadius) and expand to outer most ring (maxRadius)
3917 for( Real dist = options->minRadius; dist <= options->maxRadius; dist += ringSpacing )
3918 {
3919
3920 //
3921 // given the spacing that we've been using for the angles on the 'idea' inner circle,
3922 // we will need more points on larger circles to cover more ground
3923 //
3924 Real angleSpacing;
3925 if( dist == options->minRadius )
3926 angleSpacing = TWO_PI;
3927 else
3928 angleSpacing = (ringSpacing / (dist + 1.0f)) * (TWO_PI / 6.0f); // larger float = more samples
3929
3930 //
3931 // on this "ring", try all the angles available to us in a circle ... we'll start at
3932 // the 'startAngle', then try 'angleSpacing' to the left, then 'angleSpacing' to the
3933 // right, then '2 angleSpacings' to the left etc., ping ponging around the start angle
3934 // until we've done them all the way around the circle
3935 //
3936
3937 // how many samples will we test
3938 Int samples = REAL_TO_INT_CEIL( (TWO_PI / angleSpacing) / 2.0f);
3939 for( Int i = 0; i < samples; ++i )
3940 {
3941
3942 // try one "side"
3943 if( tryPosition( center, dist, startAngle + angleSpacing * i, options, result ) == TRUE )
3944 return TRUE;
3945
3946 //
3947 // try the other "side" ... note for the first point at minRadius this position is
3948 // the same so we won't test it again in that case
3949 //
3950 if( i != 0 )
3951 if( tryPosition( center, dist, startAngle - angleSpacing * i, options, result ) == TRUE )
3952 return TRUE;
3953
3954 } // end if
3955
3956 } // end for, dist
3957
3958 // no position was able to be found
3959 return FALSE;
3960
3961} // end findPositionAround
3962
3963//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3964// This is the main accessor of the shroud system. At this level, allies are taken
3965// into consideration as specified by the caller. Look/Unlook are the ones sending Ally info, as that
3966// is in Object where Allies make sense. AddLooker literally just adds a looker for the player you specify.
3967// This way, Full map reveals and Observer mode active look will not carry over to all
3968// allies. They'll use the RevealWholeDamnMap series, which call addLooker directly.
3969void PartitionManager::doShroudReveal(Real centerX, Real centerY, Real radius, PlayerMaskType playerMask)
3970{
3971 Int cellCenterX, cellCenterY;
3972 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell(centerX, centerY, &cellCenterX, &cellCenterY);
3973
3974 Int cellRadius = ThePartitionManager->worldToCellDist(radius);
3975 if (cellRadius < 1)
3976 cellRadius = 1;
3977
3978 DiscreteCircle circle(cellCenterX, cellCenterY, cellRadius);
3979
3980 for( Int currentIndex = ThePlayerList->getPlayerCount() - 1; currentIndex >=0; currentIndex-- )
3981 {
3982 // Object's Look is the one who knows about allies. Anyone can pask a player mask to me and all
3983 // of those players will have an active looker applied to a bunch of cells
3984 const Player *currentPlayer = ThePlayerList->getNthPlayer( currentIndex );
3985 if( BitTest( playerMask, currentPlayer->getPlayerMask() ) )
3986 {
3987 circle.drawCircle(hLineAddLooker, (void*)currentIndex);
3988 }
3989 }
3990}
3991
3992//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3993void PartitionManager::processPendingUndoShroudRevealQueue( Bool considerTimestamp )
3994{
3995 //Keep going until the front one is in the future. UndoShroudReveal on each one you process.
3996 //Again, you know these are in order, because we control the adding of the Constant in-the-queue time.
3997 UnsignedInt compareTime;
3998 if(considerTimestamp)
3999 compareTime = TheGameLogic->getFrame();
4000 else
4001 compareTime = UINT_MAX;
4002
4003 while( !m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.empty() && (m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.front()->m_data < compareTime) )
4004 {
4005 SightingInfo *thisInfo = m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.front();
4006
4007 undoShroudReveal( thisInfo->m_where.x, thisInfo->m_where.y, thisInfo->m_howFar, thisInfo->m_forWhom );
4008
4009 thisInfo->deleteInstance();
4010 m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.pop();
4011 }
4012}
4013
4014//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4015void PartitionManager::processEntirePendingUndoShroudRevealQueue()
4016{
4017 // Something major is about to happen, so we need to rush through our queue and get everything in order.
4018 // Examples are map resize, full map undo-reveal, stuff like that.
4019
4020 // Don't like duplicating code, so route to original function.
4021 processPendingUndoShroudRevealQueue(FALSE);
4022}
4023
4024//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4025void PartitionManager::resetPendingUndoShroudRevealQueue()
4026{
4027 while( !m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.empty() )
4028 {
4029 SightingInfo *thisInfo = m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.front();
4030 thisInfo->deleteInstance();
4031 m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.pop();
4032 }
4033}

4035//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4036void PartitionManager::undoShroudReveal(Real centerX, Real centerY, Real radius, PlayerMaskType playerMask)
4037{
4038 Int cellCenterX, cellCenterY;
4039 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell(centerX, centerY, &cellCenterX, &cellCenterY);
4040
4041 Int cellRadius = ThePartitionManager->worldToCellDist(radius);
4042 if (cellRadius < 1)
4043 cellRadius = 1;
4044
4045 DiscreteCircle circle(cellCenterX, cellCenterY, cellRadius);
4046
4047 for( Int currentIndex = ThePlayerList->getPlayerCount() - 1; currentIndex >=0; currentIndex-- )
4048 {
4049 const Player *currentPlayer = ThePlayerList->getNthPlayer( currentIndex );
4050 if( BitTest( playerMask, currentPlayer->getPlayerMask() ) )
4051 {
4052 circle.drawCircle(hLineRemoveLooker, (void*)currentIndex);
4053 }
4054 }
4055}

4057//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4058void PartitionManager::queueUndoShroudReveal(Real centerX, Real centerY, Real radius, PlayerMaskType playerMask)
4059{
4060 UnsignedInt now = TheGameLogic->getFrame();
4061 SightingInfo *newInfo = newInstance(SightingInfo);
4062
4063 newInfo->m_where.x = centerX;
4064 newInfo->m_where.y = centerY;
4065 newInfo->m_howFar = radius;
4066 newInfo->m_forWhom = playerMask;
4067 newInfo->m_data = now + TheGlobalData->m_unlookPersistDuration;
4068
4069 m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.push(newInfo);
4070}

4250//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4251void PartitionManager::getCellCenterPos(Int x, Int y, Real& xx, Real& yy)
4252{
4253 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(x >= 0 && y >= 0, ("hmm, invalid cell"));
4254 Real half = m_cellSize*0.5f;
4255 xx = m_worldExtents.lo.x + (x * m_cellSize) + half;
4256 yy = m_worldExtents.lo.y + (y * m_cellSize) + half;
4257}

4259//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4260#ifdef PM_CACHE_TERRAIN_HEIGHT
4261
4262 struct TerrainExtremeData
4263 {
4264 Real* minZ;
4265 Real* maxZ;
4266 Coord2D* minZPos;
4267 Coord2D* maxZPos;
4268 Bool isValid;
4269 };
4270
4271static Int checkTerrainExtreme(PartitionCell* cell, void* userData)
4272{
4273 TerrainExtremeData* data = (TerrainExtremeData*)userData;
4274
4275 data->isValid = true;
4276
4277 Real tmp;
4278
4279 if (data->minZ)
4280 {
4281 tmp = cell->getLoTerrain();
4282 if (tmp < *data->minZ )
4283 {
4284 *data->minZ = tmp;
4285 if (data->minZPos)
4286 {
4287 cell->getCellCenterPos(data->minZPos->x, data->minZPos->y);
4288 }
4289 }
4290 }
4291
4292 if (data->maxZ)
4293 {
4294 tmp = cell->getHiTerrain();
4295 if (tmp > *data->maxZ )
4296 {
4297 *data->maxZ = tmp;
4298 if (data->maxZPos)
4299 {
4300 cell->getCellCenterPos(data->maxZPos->x, data->maxZPos->y);
4301 }
4302 }
4303 }
4304
4305 return 0; // zero to continue
4306}
4307#endif
4308
4309//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4310#ifdef PM_CACHE_TERRAIN_HEIGHT
4311Bool PartitionManager::estimateTerrainExtremesAlongLine(const Coord3D& pos, const Coord3D& posOther, Real* minZ, Real* maxZ, Coord2D* minZPos, Coord2D* maxZPos)
4312{
4313 TerrainExtremeData data;
4314 data.minZ = minZ;
4315 data.maxZ = maxZ;
4316 data.minZPos = minZPos;
4317 data.maxZPos = maxZPos;
4318 data.isValid = false;
4319 if (minZ) *minZ = HUGE_DIST;
4320 if (maxZ) *maxZ = -HUGE_DIST;
4321 iterateCellsAlongLine(pos, posOther, checkTerrainExtreme, &data);
4322 return data.isValid;
4323}
4324#endif
4325
4326//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4327// Uses Bresenham line algorithm from www.gamedev.net.
4328Int PartitionManager::iterateCellsAlongLine(const Coord3D& pos, const Coord3D& posOther, CellAlongLineProc proc, void* userData)
4329{
4330 ICoord2D start, end, delta;
4331 Int x, y;
4332 Int xinc1, xinc2;
4333 Int yinc1, yinc2;
4334 Int den, num, numadd;
4335 Int numpixels;
4336
4337 worldToCell(pos.x, pos.y, &start.x, &start.y);
4338 worldToCell(posOther.x, posOther.y, &end.x, &end.y);
4339
4340 delta.x = abs(end.x - start.x); // The difference between the x's
4341 delta.y = abs(end.y - start.y); // The difference between the y's
4342 x = start.x; // Start x off at the first pixel
4343 y = start.y; // Start y off at the first pixel
4344
4345 if (end.x >= start.x) // The x-values are increasing
4346 {
4347 xinc1 = 1;
4348 xinc2 = 1;
4349 }
4350 else // The x-values are decreasing
4351 {
4352 xinc1 = -1;
4353 xinc2 = -1;
4354 }
4355
4356 if (end.y >= start.y) // The y-values are increasing
4357 {
4358 yinc1 = 1;
4359 yinc2 = 1;
4360 }
4361 else // The y-values are decreasing
4362 {
4363 yinc1 = -1;
4364 yinc2 = -1;
4365 }
4366 Bool checkY = true;
4367 if (delta.x >= delta.y) // There is at least one x-value for every y-value
4368 {
4369 xinc1 = 0; // Don't change the x when numerator >= denominator
4370 yinc2 = 0; // Don't change the y for every iteration
4371 den = delta.x;
4372 num = delta.x / 2;
4373 numadd = delta.y;
4374 numpixels = delta.x; // There are more x-values than y-values
4375 }
4376 else // There is at least one y-value for every x-value
4377 {
4378 checkY = false;
4379 xinc2 = 0; // Don't change the x for every iteration
4380 yinc1 = 0; // Don't change the y when numerator >= denominator
4381 den = delta.y;
4382 num = delta.y / 2;
4383 numadd = delta.x;
4384 numpixels = delta.y; // There are more y-values than x-values
4385 }
4386
4387 for (Int curpixel = 0; curpixel <= numpixels; curpixel++)
4388 {
4389 PartitionCell* cell = ThePartitionManager->getCellAt(x, y); // might be null if off the edge
4390 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(cell != NULL, ("off the map"));
4391 if (cell)
4392 {
4393 Int ret = (*proc)(cell, userData);
4394 if (ret != 0)
4395 return ret; // bail early
4396 }
4397
4398 num += numadd; // Increase the numerator by the top of the fraction
4399 if (num >= den) // Check if numerator >= denominator
4400 {
4401 num -= den; // Calculate the new numerator value
4402 x += xinc1; // Change the x as appropriate
4403 y += yinc1; // Change the y as appropriate
4404 }
4405 x += xinc2; // Change the x as appropriate
4406 y += yinc2; // Change the y as appropriate
4407 }
4408
4409 return 0;
4410}
4411
4412//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4413Int PartitionManager::iterateCellsBreadthFirst(const Coord3D *pos, CellBreadthFirstProc proc, void *userData)
4414{
4415 // starting at pos, iterate the cells in the following manner:
4416 // left, up, right, down
4417 // using Breadth-first search.
4418 // Call proc on each cell, and if it returns non-zero, then return the cell index
4419 // -1 means error, but we should add a define later for this.
4420
4421 Int cellX, cellY;
4422 ThePartitionManager->worldToCell(pos->x, pos->y, &cellX, &cellY);
4423
4424 // Note, bool. not Bool, cause bool will cause this to be a bitfield.
4425 std::vector<bool> bitField;
4426 Int cellCount = m_cellCountX * m_cellCountY;
4427 bitField.resize(cellCount);
4428 // 0 means not done, 1 means done.
4429
4430 for (Int i = 0; i < cellCount; ++i) {
4431 bitField[i] = false;
4432 }
4433
4434 std::queue<PartitionCell *> cellQ;
4435
4436 // mark the starting cell done
4437 bitField[cellY * m_cellCountX + cellX] = true;
4438 cellQ.push(&m_cells[cellY * m_cellCountX + cellX]);
4439
4440 Int curX = cellX;
4441 Int curY = cellY;
4442 while (!cellQ.empty()) {
4443 // first, add the neighbors
4444 // left
4445 if (curX - 1 >= 0) {
4446 if (!bitField[curY * m_cellCountX + curX - 1]) {
4447 bitField[curY * m_cellCountX + curX - 1] = true;
4448 cellQ.push(&m_cells[curY * m_cellCountX + curX - 1]);
4449 }
4450 }
4451
4452 // top
4453 if (curY - 1 >= 0) {
4454 if (!bitField[(curY - 1) * m_cellCountX + curX]) {
4455 bitField[(curY - 1) * m_cellCountX + curX] = true;
4456 cellQ.push(&m_cells[(curY - 1) * m_cellCountX + curX]);
4457 }
4458 }
4459
4460 // right
4461 if (curX + 1 < m_cellCountX) {
4462 if (!bitField[curY * m_cellCountX + curX + 1]) {
4463 bitField[curY * m_cellCountX + curX + 1] = true;
4464 cellQ.push(&m_cells[curY * m_cellCountX + curX + 1]);
4465 }
4466 }
4467
4468 // bottom
4469 if (curY + 1 > 0) {
4470 if (!bitField[(curY + 1) * m_cellCountX + curX]) {
4471 bitField[(curY + 1) * m_cellCountX + curX] = true;
4472 cellQ.push(&m_cells[(curY + 1) * m_cellCountX + curX]);
4473 }
4474 }
4475
4476 // now process the current top.
4477 PartitionCell *curCell = cellQ.front();
4478 cellQ.pop();
4479 curX = curCell->getCellX();
4480 curY = curCell->getCellY();
4481
4482 if ((proc)(curCell, userData) != 0)
4483 return (curCell->getCellY() * m_cellCountX + curCell->getCellX());
4484 }
4485
4486 return -1;
4487}
4488
4489//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4490static Real calcDist2D(Real x1, Real y1, Real x2, Real y2)
4491{
4492 return sqrtf(sqr(x1-x2) + sqr(y1-y2));
4493}
4494
4495//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4496Bool PartitionManager::isClearLineOfSightTerrain(const Object* obj, const Coord3D& objPos, const Object* other, const Coord3D& otherPos)
4497{
4498 Coord3D pos, posOther;
4499
4500 if (obj)
4501 {
4502 pos = *obj->getPosition();
4503 // note that we want to measure from the top of the collision
4504 // shape, not the bottom! (most objects have eyes a lot closer
4505 // to their head than their feet. if we have really odd critters
4506 // with eye-feet, we'll need to change this assumption.)
4507 pos.z += obj->getGeometryInfo().getMaxHeightAbovePosition();
4508 }
4509 else
4510 {
4511 pos = objPos;
4512 }
4513
4514 if (other)
4515 {
4516 posOther = *other->getPosition();
4517 // note that we want to measure from the top of the collision
4518 // shape, not the bottom! (most objects have eyes a lot closer
4519 // to their head than their feet. if we have really odd critters
4520 // with eye-feet, we'll need to change this assumption.)
4521 posOther.z += other->getGeometryInfo().getMaxHeightAbovePosition();
4522 }
4523 else
4524 {
4525 posOther = otherPos;
4526 }
4527
4528#ifdef NO_BAD_AND_INACCURATE
4529/*
4530 This looks tempting, and in theory would be better than the below code; however, it
4531 is not (yet) accurate enough for our targeting needs. what we really need to do is add a Bresenham
4532 line iterator to the TerrainLogic itself, which would probably suffice. Until then, this code is
4533 left in as an example of what NOT to do. (srj)
4534*/
4535 Real maxZ;
4536 Coord2D maxZPos;
4537 Bool valid = estimateTerrainExtremesAlongLine(pos, posOther, NULL, &maxZ, NULL, &maxZPos);
4538 DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(valid, ("this should never happen unless both positions are off-map"));
4539 if (!valid)
4540 return true;
4541
4542 Real terrainAtHighPoint = maxZ;
4543
4544 Real totalDist2D = calcDist2D(pos.x, pos.y, posOther.x, posOther.y);
4545 Real terrainDist2D = calcDist2D(pos.x, pos.y, maxZPos.x, maxZPos.y);
4546
4547 const Real TINY_DIST = 0.01f;
4548 Real percent = (totalDist2D > TINY_DIST) ? (terrainDist2D / totalDist2D) : 0.0f;
4549 if (percent < 0.0f) percent = 0.0f;
4550 if (percent > 1.0f) percent = 1.0f;
4551
4552 Real lineOfSightAtHighPoint = pos.z + (posOther.z - pos.z) * percent;
4553
4554 // if terrainAtHighPoint > lineOfSightAtHighPoint, we can't see.
4555 // add a little fudge to account for slop.
4556 const Real LOS_FUDGE = 0.5f;
4557 if (terrainAtHighPoint > lineOfSightAtHighPoint + LOS_FUDGE)
4558 {
4559 //DEBUG_LOG(("isClearLineOfSightTerrain fails\n"));
4560 return false;
4561 }
4562
4563 return true;
4564
4565#else
4566 return TheTerrainLogic->isClearLineOfSight(pos, posOther);
4567#endif
4568}
4569
4570// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4572// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4573void PartitionManager::crc( Xfer *xfer )
4574{
4575
4576 for (Int i=0; i<m_totalCellCount; ++i)
4577 {
4578 m_cells[i].crc(xfer);
4579 }
4580
4581} // end crc
4582
4583// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4589// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4590void PartitionManager::xfer( Xfer *xfer )
4591{
4592
4593 // version
4594 XferVersion currentVersion = 2;
4595 XferVersion version = currentVersion;
4596 xfer->xferVersion( &version, currentVersion );
4597
4598 // cell size information
4599 Real cellSize = m_cellSize;
4600 xfer->xferReal( &cellSize );
4601
4602 //
4603 // cell size should match what we have allocated in the partition manager, if it doesn't
4604 // we need to increment the version here and edit this code to be able to load
4605 // the old cell size if changed after we release
4606 //
4607 if( cellSize != m_cellSize )
4608 {
4609
4610 DEBUG_CRASH(( "Partition cell size has changed, this save game file is invalid\n" ));
4611 throw SC_INVALID_DATA;
4612
4613 } // end if
4614
4615 // cell count
4616 Int totalCellCount = m_totalCellCount;
4617 xfer->xferInt( &totalCellCount );
4618
4619 // total cell count better match what we have allocated for cells in the partition manager
4620 if( totalCellCount != m_totalCellCount )
4621 {
4622
4623 DEBUG_CRASH(( "Partition total cell count mismatch %d, should be %d\n",
4624 totalCellCount, m_totalCellCount ));
4625 throw SC_INVALID_DATA;
4626
4627 } // end if
4628
4629 // xfer each cell information
4630 PartitionCell *cell;
4631 for( Int i = 0; i < totalCellCount; ++i )
4632 {
4633
4634 // get this partition cell
4635 cell = &m_cells[ i ];
4636
4637 // xfer the data for this cell
4638 xfer->xferSnapshot( cell );
4639
4640 } // end for i
4641
4642 // when loading tell the partition manager to rethink and refresh all shroud information
4643 if( xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD )
4644 {
4645
4646 // tell partition manager to re-evaluate shroud things when next asked
4647 m_updatedSinceLastReset = FALSE;
4648
4649 // refresh the shroud for the local player which will update the radar and everything
4650 refreshShroudForLocalPlayer();
4651
4652 } // end if
4653
4654 if( version >= 2 )
4655 {
4656 Int queueSize = m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.size();
4657 xfer->xferInt(&queueSize);
4658 // This xfer thing is still cool. On save, I just wrote the number of elements. On load, the first line
4659 // above was a decoy, and the second found out the size.
4660
4661 if(xfer->getXferMode() == XFER_LOAD)
4662 {
4663 // have to remove this assert, because during load there is a setTeam call for each guy on a sub-team, and that results
4664 // in a queued unlook, so we actually have stuff in here at the start. I am fairly certain that setTeam should wait
4665 // until loadPostProcess, but I ain't gonna change it now.
4666// DEBUG_ASSERTCRASH(m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.size() == 0, ("At load, we appear to not be in a reset state.") );
4667
4668 // I have to split this up though, since on Load I need to make new instances.
4669 for( Int infoIndex = 0; infoIndex < queueSize; infoIndex++ )
4670 {
4671 SightingInfo *newInfo = newInstance(SightingInfo);
4672 xfer->xferSnapshot(newInfo);
4673 m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.push(newInfo);
4674 }
4675 }
4676 else
4677 {
4678 // And on Save, I need to loop through, but not destroy anything, so I pop-push n times, cycling through the queue once
4679 // (No random access on queues, and speed not a concern in saveload)
4680 for( Int infoIndex = 0; infoIndex < queueSize; infoIndex++ )
4681 {
4682 SightingInfo *saveInfo = m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.front();
4683 xfer->xferSnapshot(saveInfo);
4684 m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.pop();
4685 m_pendingUndoShroudReveals.push(saveInfo);
4686 }
4687 }
4688
4689 }
4690 else
4691 {
4692 // Version 1 save games will just not have any SightingInfos in the queue to be undone.
4693 }
4694
4695} // end xfer
4696

4701{
4702
4703} // end loadPostProcess

4705//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4706Real PartitionManager::getGroundOrStructureHeight(Real posx, Real posy)
4707{
4708 // get the terrain height
4709 Real terrainHeightHere = TheTerrainLogic->getGroundHeight( posx, posy );
4710
4711 // scan all objects in the radius of our extent and find the tallest height among them
4712 PartitionFilterAcceptByKindOf filter1( MAKE_KINDOF_MASK( KINDOF_STRUCTURE ), KINDOFMASK_NONE );
4713 PartitionFilter *filters[] = { &filter1, NULL };
4714 Coord3D pos;
4715 pos.x = posx;
4716 pos.y = posy;
4717 pos.z = terrainHeightHere;
4718 const Real RANGE = 1.0f;
4719 ObjectIterator *iter = iterateObjectsInRange( &pos, RANGE, FROM_BOUNDINGSPHERE_2D, filters );
4720 MemoryPoolObjectHolder hold( iter );
4721
4722 Real tallestHeight = 0.0f;
4723 Real thisHeight;
4724 for( Object* obj = iter->first(); obj; obj = iter->next() )
4725 {
4726 // store the height of the tallest object under us
4727 thisHeight = obj->getGeometryInfo().getMaxHeightAbovePosition();
4728 if( thisHeight > tallestHeight )
4729 tallestHeight = thisHeight;
4730
4731 }
4732
4733 return terrainHeightHere + tallestHeight;
4734}
4735
4736//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4737void PartitionManager::getMostValuableLocation( Int playerIndex, UnsignedInt whichPlayerTypes, ValueOrThreat valType, Coord3D *outLocation )
4738{
4739 if (!outLocation)
4740 return;
4741
4742 PlayerMaskType playerMask = ThePlayerList->getPlayersWithRelationship(playerIndex, whichPlayerTypes);
4743 if (playerMask == 0)
4744 return;
4745
4746 Int cellCount = m_cellCountX * m_cellCountY;
4747
4748 PlayerMaskType allPlayerMasks[MAX_PLAYER_COUNT] = { 0 };
4749 Int totalPlayerCount = ThePlayerList->getPlayerCount();
4750
4751 Int i;
4752 for (i = 0; i < totalPlayerCount; ++i) {
4753 Player *player = ThePlayerList->getNthPlayer(i);
4754 if (!player) {
4755 continue;
4756 }
4757
4758 allPlayerMasks[i] = player->getPlayerMask();
4759 }
4760
4761 Int greatestValueCell = -1;
4762 Int maxCellValue = -1;
4763 for (i = 0; i < cellCount; ++i) {
4764 Int cellValue = 0;
4765
4766 for (Int player = 0; player < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++player) {
4767 if (BitTest(allPlayerMasks[player], playerMask)) {
4768 if (valType == VOT_CashValue) {
4769 cellValue += m_cells[i].getCashValue(player);
4770 } else {
4771 cellValue += m_cells[i].getThreatValue(player);
4772 }
4773 }
4774 }
4775
4776 if (cellValue > maxCellValue) {
4777 maxCellValue = cellValue;
4778 greatestValueCell = i;
4779 }
4780 }
4781
4782 if (greatestValueCell == -1 || maxCellValue == -1) {
4783 DEBUG_CRASH(("PartitionManager::getMostValuableLocation: jkmcd"));
4784 return;
4785 }
4786
4787 outLocation->set(m_cells[greatestValueCell].getCellX() * TheGlobalData->m_partitionCellSize,
4788 m_cells[greatestValueCell].getCellY() * TheGlobalData->m_partitionCellSize,
4789 0
4790 );
4791}
4792
4793//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4794void PartitionManager::getNearestGroupWithValue( Int playerIndex, UnsignedInt whichPlayerTypes, ValueOrThreat valType,
4795 const Coord3D *sourceLocation, Int valueRequired, Bool greaterThan, Coord3D *outLocation )
4796{
4797 if (!(sourceLocation && outLocation))
4798 return;
4799
4800 PlayerMaskType playerMask = ThePlayerList->getPlayersWithRelationship(playerIndex, whichPlayerTypes);
4801 if (playerMask == 0)
4802 return;
4803
4804 PlayerMaskType allPlayerMasks[MAX_PLAYER_COUNT] = { 0 };
4805 Int totalPlayerCount = ThePlayerList->getPlayerCount();
4806
4807 Int i;
4808 for (i = 0; i < totalPlayerCount; ++i) {
4809 Player *player = ThePlayerList->getNthPlayer(i);
4810 if (!player) {
4811 continue;
4812 }
4813
4814 allPlayerMasks[i] = player->getPlayerMask();
4815 }
4816
4817 CellValueProcParms parms;
4818 parms.valueRequired = valueRequired;
4819 parms.greaterThan = valueRequired;
4820 parms.valueType = valType;
4821 parms.allowedPlayersMasks = playerMask;
4822 for (i = 0; i < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++i)
4823 parms.allPlayersMask[i] = allPlayerMasks[i];
4824
4825 Int nearestGreat = iterateCellsBreadthFirst(sourceLocation, cellValueProc, &parms);
4826 if (nearestGreat != -1) {
4827 (*outLocation).x = m_cells[nearestGreat].getCellX() * TheGlobalData->m_partitionCellSize;
4828 (*outLocation).y = m_cells[nearestGreat].getCellY() * TheGlobalData->m_partitionCellSize;
4829 (*outLocation).z = 0;
4830 }
4831
4832 // all done
4833}
4834
4835//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4836void PartitionManager::storeFoggedCells(ShroudStatusStoreRestore &outPartitionStore, Bool storeToFog) const
4837{
4838 Int i, j, p;
4839
4840 if (storeToFog) {
4841 // This is the first pass
4842 outPartitionStore.m_cellsWide = m_cellCountX;
4843
4844 // Resize all of our arrays.
4845 for (p = 0; p < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++p) {
4846 outPartitionStore.m_foggedOrRevealed[p].resize(m_totalCellCount);
4847 for (i = 0; i < m_totalCellCount; ++i) {
4848 outPartitionStore.m_foggedOrRevealed[p][i] = STORE_DONTTOUCH;
4849 }
4850 }
4851 }
4852
4853 for (p = 0; p < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++p) {
4854 if (outPartitionStore.m_foggedOrRevealed[p].size() != m_totalCellCount) {
4855 DEBUG_CRASH(("PartitionManager::storeFoggedCells: jkmcd - x36872"));
4856 continue;
4857 }
4858
4859 for (j = 0; j < m_cellCountY; ++j) {
4860 for (i = 0; i < m_cellCountX; ++i) {
4861 UnsignedByte &byteToWrite = outPartitionStore.m_foggedOrRevealed[p][j * m_cellCountX + i];
4862
4863 if (storeToFog && m_cells[j * m_cellCountX + i].getShroudStatusForPlayer(p) == CELLSHROUD_FOGGED) {
4864 byteToWrite = STORE_FOG;
4865 }
4866
4867 if (!storeToFog && m_cells[j * m_cellCountX + i].getShroudStatusForPlayer(p) == CELLSHROUD_CLEAR) {
4868 byteToWrite = STORE_PERMANENTLY_REVEALED;
4869 }
4870 }
4871 }
4872 }
4873}
4874
4875//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4876void PartitionManager::restoreFoggedCells(const ShroudStatusStoreRestore &inPartitionStore, Bool restoreToFog)
4877{
4878 Int i, j, p;
4879
4880 Int storeWidth = inPartitionStore.m_cellsWide;
4881 Int storeHeight = inPartitionStore.m_foggedOrRevealed[0].size() / storeWidth;
4882
4883 for (p = 0; p < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++p) {
4884 for (j = 0; j < storeHeight; ++j) {
4885 if (j >= m_cellCountY) {
4886 // All done.
4887 return;
4888 }
4889
4890 for (i = 0; i < storeWidth; ++i) {
4891 if (i >= m_cellCountX) {
4892 // Skip to the next line. This info will be thrown away.
4893 break;
4894 }
4895
4896 UnsignedByte byteToRestore = inPartitionStore.m_foggedOrRevealed[p][j * storeWidth + i];
4897 if (byteToRestore == STORE_DONTTOUCH) {
4898 continue;
4899 }
4900
4901 if (byteToRestore == STORE_FOG && restoreToFog) {
4902 // restore the fog status of this cell
4903 m_cells[j * m_cellCountX + i].addLooker(p);
4904 m_cells[j * m_cellCountX + i].removeLooker(p);
4905 }
4906
4907 if (byteToRestore == STORE_PERMANENTLY_REVEALED && !restoreToFog) {
4908 // Add an extra looker.
4909 m_cells[j * m_cellCountX + i].addLooker(p);
4910 }
4911 }
4912 }
4913 }
4914}

4922PartitionFilterRejectBuildings::PartitionFilterRejectBuildings(const Object *o) :
4923 m_self(o),
4924 m_acquireEnemies(false)
4925{
4926 // if I am a computer-controlled opponent, auto-aquire enemy buildings

4933//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4934Bool PartitionFilterRejectBuildings::allow( Object *other )
4935{
4936 // this filter allows all non-buildings
4937 // um, no, it clearly doesn't any more.
4938 // didn't the person adding the code below read the comment?
4939 if (!other->isKindOf( KINDOF_STRUCTURE ))
4940 return true;
4941
4942 const Player* myPlayer = m_self->getControllingPlayer();
4943 if (!myPlayer)
4944 return false;
4945
4946 // Get the controlling team of other.
4947 ContainModuleInterface* contain = other->getContain();
4948 const Player* otherPlayer = contain ? contain->getApparentControllingPlayer(myPlayer) : NULL;
4949
4950 if (!otherPlayer)
4951 otherPlayer = other->getControllingPlayer();
4952
4953 if (!otherPlayer)
4954 return false;
4955
4956 Relationship relationship = myPlayer->getRelationship(otherPlayer->getDefaultTeam());
4957 if (relationship != ENEMIES)
4958 return false;
4959
4960 // if I am a computer-controlled opponent, auto-aquire enemy buildings (if we can see them!)
4961 if (m_acquireEnemies)
4962 return true;
4963
4964 if (other->isKindOf( KINDOF_FS_BASE_DEFENSE))
4965 {
4966 // Don't reject base defenses.
4967 return true;
4968 }
4969
4970 if (other->getContain() != NULL && other->isAbleToAttack())
4971 {
4972 // Don't reject garrisoned buildings that can attack
4973 return true;
4974 }
4975
4976 return false;
4977}

4995 return false;
4996 }
4997 }
4998 }
4999 return true;
5000
5001 } else {
5002 if (m_allowNonBuildings) {
5003 return true;
5004 }
5005 }
5006

5011//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5012//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5013
5014
5015//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5016
5017Bool PartitionFilterRepulsor::allow( Object *other )
5018{
5019 if (other == m_self)
5020 {
5021 // don't repulse yourself. :)
5022 return false;
5023 }
5024
5025 // If it's flagged, it's a repulsor.
5026 if (other->testStatus(OBJECT_STATUS_REPULSOR))
5027 {
5028 return true;
5029 }
5030
5031 if (other->isEffectivelyDead())
5032 return false; // no dead enemies.
5033
5034 Relationship r = m_self->getRelationship(other);
5035 if (r != ENEMIES)
5036 {
5037 return false; // only enemies auto repulse.
5038 }
5039
5040 if (other->isKindOf( KINDOF_STRUCTURE ))
5041 {
5042 // always pay attention to buildings that can attack
5043 if (other->isAbleToAttack())
5044 return true;
5045 return false;
5046 }
5047
5048 if ( other->isKindOf( KINDOF_INERT ))
5049 return false;
5050
5051
5052 if ( ! other->isAbleToAttack() )
5053 {
5054 return false;
5055 }
5056
5057 return true;
5058}

5089//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5090Bool PartitionFilterPlayerAffiliation::allow( Object *other )
5091{
5092 Relationship rel = m_player->getRelationship(other->getTeam());
5093 switch (rel)
5094 {
5095 case ENEMIES:
5096 if (m_affiliation & ALLOW_ENEMIES) {
5097 return m_match;
5098 }
5099 break;
5100
5101 case NEUTRAL:
5102 if (m_affiliation & ALLOW_NEUTRAL) {
5103 return m_match;
5104 }
5105 break;
5106
5107 case ALLIES:
5108 if (m_affiliation & ALLOW_ALLIES) {
5109 return m_match;
5110 }
5111 break;
5112 }
5113
5114 if (other->getControllingPlayer() == m_player) {
5115 return m_match;
5116 }
5117
5118 return !m_match;
5119}

5166//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5167//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5168//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5169
5170//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5171PartitionFilterWouldCollide::PartitionFilterWouldCollide(const Coord3D& pos, const GeometryInfo& geom, Real angle, Bool desired) :
5172 m_position(pos),
5173 m_geom(geom),
5174 m_angle(angle),
5175 m_desiredCollisionResult(desired)
5176{
5177}
5178
5179//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5180
5181Bool PartitionFilterWouldCollide::allow(Object *objOther)
5182{
5183 CollideInfo thisInfo(&m_position, m_geom, m_angle);
5184 CollideInfo thatInfo(objOther->getPosition(), objOther->getGeometryInfo(), objOther->getOrientation());
5185
5186 Bool doesCollide;
5187
5188 // invariant for all geometries: first do z collision check.
5189 if (thisInfo.position.z + thisInfo.geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition() >= thatInfo.position.z &&
5190 thisInfo.position.z <= thatInfo.position.z + thatInfo.geom.getMaxHeightAbovePosition())
5191 {
5192 GeometryType thisGeom = m_geom.getGeomType();
5193 GeometryType thatGeom = objOther->getGeometryInfo().getGeomType();
5194
5195 //
5196 // NOTE: This assumes geometry enumerations that start at GEOMETRY_FIRST AND depends on the
5197 // order in which they appear in the enum list
5198 //
5199 CollideTestProc collideProc = theCollideTestProcs[ (thisGeom - GEOMETRY_FIRST) * GEOMETRY_NUM_TYPES + (thatGeom - GEOMETRY_FIRST) ];
5200 CollideLocAndNormal cinfo;
5201 doesCollide = (*collideProc)(&thisInfo, &thatInfo, &cinfo);
5202 }
5203 else
5204 {
5205 // no z-intersection -> no collision.
5206 doesCollide = false;
5207 }
5208
5209 return doesCollide == m_desiredCollisionResult;
5210}

5310Bool PartitionFilterRejectBehind::allow( Object *other )

5316 Vector3 dir = m_obj->getTransformMatrix()->Get_X_Vector();

5318//const Coord3D *otherPos = other->getPosition();

5412//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5413Bool PartitionFilterPossibleToHijack::allow(Object *objOther)
5414{
5415 if (!objOther || !m_obj)
5416 return FALSE;
5417
5418 if( TheActionManager->canHijackVehicle(m_obj, objOther, m_commandSource) )
5419 return TRUE;
5420 else
5421 return FALSE;
5422}

5496//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5497//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5498//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5499
5500//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5501Bool PartitionFilterStealthedAndUndetected::allow( Object *objOther )
5502{
5503 // objOther is guaranteed to be non-null, so we don't need to check (srj)
5504
5505 Bool stealthed = objOther->testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_STEALTHED );
5506 Bool detected = objOther->testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_DETECTED );
5507 Bool disguised = objOther->testStatus( OBJECT_STATUS_DISGUISED );
5508
5509 if( stealthed && !detected )
5510 {
5511 if( !objOther->isKindOf( KINDOF_DISGUISER ) )
5512 {
5513 //We have a stealthed & undetected object.
5514 return m_allow;
5515 }
5516 else if( disguised )
5517 {
5518 //Exception case -- bomb trucks can't be considered stealthed units when they are disguised as the enemy.
5519
5520 StealthUpdate *update = objOther->getStealth();
5521
5522 if( update && update->isDisguised() )
5523 {
5524 Player *ourPlayer = m_obj->getControllingPlayer();
5525 Player *otherPlayer = ThePlayerList->getNthPlayer( update->getDisguisedPlayerIndex() );
5526 if( ourPlayer && otherPlayer )
5527 {
5528 if( ourPlayer->getRelationship( otherPlayer->getDefaultTeam() ) == ENEMIES )
5529 {
5530 //Our stealthed & undetected object is disguised as a unit perceived to be our enemy,
5531 //therefore it's not considered to be stealthed!
5532 return !m_allow;
5533 }
5534 //Our object is disguised as a "friendly" object, therefore it's considered to be stealthed.
5535 return m_allow;
5536 }
5537 }
5538 //Our bomb truck is not disguised therefore it's not stealthed.
5539 return !m_allow;
5540 }
5541 }
5542 else
5543 {
5544 //This handles neutral containers that hold stealth units. This specifically fixes a bug where hunt scripts would ignore
5545 //this case -- units would acquire the building Jarmen Kell occupied even though it was not stealth detected.
5546 const ContainModuleInterface* contain = objOther->getContain();
5547 if( contain )
5548 {
5549 const Player* victimApparentController = contain->getApparentControllingPlayer( m_obj->getControllingPlayer() );
5550 //Check if it's stealthed!
5551 if( contain->getStealthUnitsContained() == contain->getContainCount() )
5552 {
5553 //Check if the first object inside is detected (if one is detected, all are detected).
5554 ContainedItemsList::const_iterator it = contain->getContainedItemsList()->begin();
5555 Object *member = (*it);
5556 if( member && !(*it)->getStatusBits().test( OBJECT_STATUS_DETECTED ) )
5557 {
5558 //Finally check the relationship!
5559 if( victimApparentController && m_obj->getTeam()->getRelationship( victimApparentController->getDefaultTeam() ) == ENEMIES )
5560 {
5561 //Our object is a neutral building garrisoned by enemy units we can't see, therefore it is stealthed.
5562 return m_allow;
5563 }
5564 }
5565 }
5566 }
5567 }
5568
5569 //The unit is not stealthed!
5570 return !m_allow;
5571}

5574//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5575//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5576//-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5577static int cellValueProc(PartitionCell* cell, void* userData)
5578{
5579 CellValueProcParms *parms = (CellValueProcParms*) userData;
5580
5581 UnsignedInt val = 0;
5582 for (Int i = 0; i < MAX_PLAYER_COUNT; ++i) {
5583 if (BitTest(parms->allowedPlayersMasks, parms->allPlayersMask[i])) {
5584 if (parms->valueType == VOT_CashValue) {
5585 val += cell->getCashValue(i);
5586 } else {
5587 val += cell->getThreatValue(i);
5588 }
5589 }
5590 }
5591
5592 if ((val > parms->valueRequired && parms->greaterThan) ||
5593 (val < parms->valueRequired && !parms->greaterThan)) {
5594 return 1;
5595 }
5596
5597 return 0;
5598}

5601static void hLineAddLooker(Int x1, Int x2, Int y, void *playerIndexVoid)
5602{
5603 if (y < 0 || y >= ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountY || x1 >= ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountX || x2 < 0)
5604 return;
5605
5606 Int playerIndex = (Int)(playerIndexVoid);
5607
5608 PartitionCell* cell = &ThePartitionManager->m_cells[y * ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountX + x1]; // yes, this could be invalid. we'll skip the bad ones.
5609 for (Int x = x1; x <= x2; ++x, ++cell)
5610 {
5611 if (x < 0 || x >= ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountX)
5612 continue;
5613 cell->addLooker(playerIndex);
5614 }
5615}

5668// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5669static void hLineAddThreat(Int x1, Int x2, Int y, void *threatValueParms)
5670{
5671 if (y < 0 || y >= ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountY || x1 >= ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountX || x2 < 0)
5672 return;
5673
5674 ThreatValueParms *parms = (ThreatValueParms*)threatValueParms;
5675
5676 Real distance;
5677 Real mulVal = 1.0f;
5678
5679 PartitionCell* cell = &ThePartitionManager->m_cells[y * ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountX + x1]; // yes, this could be invalid. we'll skip the bad ones.
5680 for (Int x = x1; x <= x2; ++x, ++cell)
5681 {
5682 if (x < 0 || x >= ThePartitionManager->m_cellCountX)
5683 continue;
5684
5685 distance = sqrt( pow(x - parms->xCenter, 2) + pow(y - parms->yCenter, 2) );
5686 mulVal = 1 - distance / parms->radius;
5687 if (mulVal < 0.0f)
5688 mulVal = 0.0f;
5689 else if (mulVal > 1.0f)
5690 mulVal = 1.0f;
5691
5692 cell->addThreatValue( parms->playerIndex, REAL_TO_UNSIGNEDINT(parms->threatOrValue * mulVal) );
5693 }
5694}
5695
